The first confirmed case of the province was in Mudanjiang City on Jan 23, 2020. According to the search results for key cities including Harbin and Mudanjiang, there are no school closing measures in place regarding to the epidemic before Jan 20, 2020.

On August 28, Heilongjiang provincial tax department provided a guideline on preferential tax policies to support epidemic prevention and control and economic and social development, which implied for the whole year (from Jan 1 to Dec 31), there would be different narrow relief (specific to some kinds of people or contract) in place.  https://archive.vn/X7LNJ

No public information campaigns before 25 Jan 2020

On January 22, Jiangxi reported the first confirmed case of new crown pneumonia. At that time, the new crown virus was still unfamiliar. At the same time, schools were basically closed at this time, so there was no requirement to close schools. However, on February 10th, the Provincial Department of Education put forward a request to delay the start of school.     https://archive.vn/uOBNW

On January 24, 2020, Jiangxi Province launched the first-level response mechanism for major public health emergencies. Based on the research of the Provincial Emergency Command for the Prevention and Control of Pneumonia Epidemics Caused by New Coronavirus Infection, it was decided to start at 18:00 on January 25 (first day of the first month) Since then, public gathering activities will be stopped, and public places such as cinemas, theaters, karaoke halls, libraries, bars, and Internet cafes will be closed.     https://archive.vn/kYJn2
On January 24, Jiangxi issued a policy requiring all festivals and activities to be suspended from the 25th.    https://archive.vn/29Ovh
Jiangxi did not issue requirements for personnel gathering at this time.
No counties or districts in Jiangxi Province have implemented traffic control during this period.

Jiangxi will stop public gathering activities from 18:00 on January 25 (the first day of the first month of the first lunar month), and strictly carry out investigation and registration management measures for close contacts and foreign personnel (especially those from Hubei, Wuhan and other epidemic areas) to Jiangxi. Dedicated personnel for grid management.     https://archive.vn/kYJn2
no measures in Jiangxi until Jan 25.

On the 23rd, the National Immigration Administration stated that foreigners who have the "four noes" will not be allowed to enter the country. For foreigners who do not meet the conditions of entry, do not truthfully answer the inquiries of the inspectors of the border inspection agency, do not truthfully fill in the information, and do not follow the prescribed procedures. The border inspection agency will disallow entry in accordance with the law.     https://archive.vn/KNwCc

On February 28, Jiangxi issued a policy to reduce the cost of water and electricity for enterprises to support the resumption of work and production. But it does not involve the subsidy standards for ordinary employees and ordinary people.     https://archive.vn/TEsQe

Starting at 18:00 on the evening of January 25, each city and county is required to conduct temperature testing of all persons on and off, and conduct centralized isolation and observation of fever patients and medical observation patients. Strictly check and register management measures for close contacts and foreign personnel (especially those from Hubei, Wuhan and other epidemic areas), and arrange dedicated personnel for grid management.     https://archive.ph/kYJn2
In 2020, the COVID-19 vaccine will not be vaccinated nationwide, and no people will be vaccinated in Jiangxi.

Thus, there has been no policy of school closing until 27 January, when the Shanghai Education Bureau decided that schools of all levels in the city would not open until 17 February. Thus, there has been no policy of workplace closing until 27 January, when the Shanghai Government issued a notice that all-but-essential sectors are not allowed to resume work after the Chinese lunar year holiday in the city until 10 February 0:00. There is no specific information about a single fund, only the overall financial support in 2020 is collected on the government website. The average exchange rate of RMB to US dollar in 2020 is 6.8974 (See China Industrial Economic Information Network, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20210202141332/http://www.cinic.org.cn/xw/schj/1024071.html).   On 3 November, 2020, the finance department released the financial performance of epidemic prevention and control, of which, the accumulated tax reduction and fee reduction of the autonomous region from January to August is 2.162 billion yuan; the social insurance premium is expected to be reduced by about 1.4 billion yuan in 2020; as of the end of September, the rent of enterprise merchants has been reduced by 69.82 million yuan. Nucleic acid detection means upgrade: After the unexplained viral pneumonia in Wuhan was identified being caused by a coronavirus infection, the relevant national research institutions developed rapidly virus nucleic acid detection kit, then make technical optimization.  On January 16, the Hubei Center for Disease Control and Prevention began to conduct etiological tests on the samples of patients with viral pneumonia of unknown cause in Wuhan after receiving the kit issued by the state.  https://archive.vn/LWKtE

Since January 17, 2020, five patients with respiratory symptoms such as fever have been found in Wenzhou, Zhoushan, Taizhou and Hangzhou in Zhejiang Province. At present, they are all isolated in designated hospitals, and their condition is stable. Medical observation has been carried out for close contacts. The laboratory test results of patients are being reviewed according to the regulations. Once the diagnosis is confirmed, it will be announced to the society in time.  Since the announcement of the national health and Health Committee's announcement of the epidemic of unknown pneumonia in Wuhan, Zhejiang attaches great importance to the prevention and control of New Coronavirus infection. According to the requirements of the provincial Party committee and the provincial government, all levels of health and health departments have responded quickly and comprehensively, and set up special working groups and expert groups in succession to formulate contingency measures and work plans in a timely manner. At present, all kinds of medical institutions and disease prevention and control institutions at all levels in our province have comprehensively strengthened the power allocation of pre triage and fever clinic, and standardized the monitoring, screening, diagnosis, treatment and disposal of suspicious cases. All parts of the province carried out in-depth patriotic health campaign, strengthened environmental improvement, managed agricultural markets well, and comprehensively implemented various prevention and control measures. On 20 January, 2020, National Health Commission of the People’s Republic of China announced that it has established a "daily report and zero report" system for epidemic situation in the whole country, and delivered novel coronavirus nucleic acid test kit to local governments, requiring all localities to strengthen testing, spare no effort to treat patients, and timely release information about confirmed cases and epidemic prevention and control.  From 21 January, 2020, National Health Commission of the People’s Republic of China began to uniformly report the pneumonia epidemic situation of novel coronavirus in all provinces of the country on the official website.  https://archive.vn/NMhHZ  https://web.archive.org/web/20210404080831/https://baijiahao.baidu.com/s?id=1656341561742146551&wfr=spider&for=pc   https://archive.vn/LWs9d

Since January 17, 2020, five patients with respiratory symptoms such as fever have been found in Wenzhou, Zhoushan, Taizhou and Hangzhou in Zhejiang Province. At present, they are all isolated in designated hospitals, and their condition is stable. Medical observation has been carried out for close contacts. The laboratory test results of patients are being reviewed according to the regulations. Once the diagnosis is confirmed, it will be announced to the society in time.  Since the announcement of the national health and Health Committee's announcement of the epidemic of unknown pneumonia in Wuhan, Zhejiang attaches great importance to the prevention and control of New Coronavirus infection. According to the requirements of the provincial Party committee and the provincial government, all levels of health and health departments have responded quickly and comprehensively, and set up special working groups and expert groups in succession to formulate contingency measures and work plans in a timely manner. At present, all kinds of medical institutions and disease prevention and control institutions at all levels in our province have comprehensively strengthened the power allocation of pre triage and fever clinic, and standardized the monitoring, screening, diagnosis, treatment and disposal of suspicious cases. All parts of the province carried out in-depth patriotic health campaign, strengthened environmental improvement, managed agricultural markets well, and comprehensively implemented various prevention and control measures.  See Health Department website, archived:   http://archive.today/2021.03.14-142230/https://wsjkw.zj.gov.cn/art/2020/1/20/art_1202101_41763414.html

On Jan 19, the first SUSPECTED case was reported. While the patient being isolated and treated, all the companions and close contacts have been under observation.    According to the news released by the provincial health commission, on later than Jan 21, Guangxi had established a leading group and an expert group for prevention and control work.     source:  https://archive.vn/Pq4B7      On Jan 22, the first CONFIRMED case was reported while comprehensive contact tracing was done for all cases and regular tracing and epidemiological surveys have been on run as well.     Source:  https://archive.vn/sVJeQ  https://archive.vn/TBIET    Therefore, here suggests that:   from January 19 to 21, the H3 indicator is assigned a value of 1;  from January 22, it is assigned a value of 2.

On Jan 22, 2020, the provincial government of Guizhou started cleanup, disinfection, and sterilization and set up temperature check-points in places such as highway entrances and exits, highway service areas, bus stations, wharves, etc.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210301090530/https://www.sohu.com/a/371050751_120214189

The Guizhou Health Committee announced the first confirmed case of covid-19 on its official website. Healthy Guizhou, the official Weibo (Weibo is the Facebook of China) account of Guizhou Health Committee, also posted the report. Since then, the Guizhou Health Committee has been posting publicly available reports daily on its official website and Weibo.   These reports contain information about the number of confirmed cases, the number of critically ill cases, the number of suspected cases, and the number of close contacts under medical observation. The reports also tell where the confirmed cases live and where they’ve recently been to.     http://www.gzhfpc.gov.cn/xwzx_500663/yqtb/202001/t20200122_44600121.html   pdf archive available upon request

On Jan 22, 2020, the provincial government of Hubei recommended that students should take care of themselves in response to the spreading epidemic.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210405155612/https://baijiahao.baidu.com/s?id=1656437271810387084&wfr=spider&for=pc

On Jan 22, 2020, the provincial government of Hubei required that markets and restaurants should take active measures to prevent the spread of the epidemic, especially in those sectors related to live stock.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210406055954/https://baijiahao.baidu.com/s?id=1656423356342364290&wfr=spider&for=pc

The Hubei Government issued the “Notice on Reinforcing the Novel Coronavirus Pandemic Prevention and Control.” According to the notice, the province launched “the emergency response policies for level 2 public health crisis.”   Under the response policies:  There’s stricter control of the movement of people. Check-points are set up at every airport, bus station, railway station, and dock. At each check-point, temperature checks are conducted, and entering people are registered. Fevered people will be reported and sent to medical facilities immediately.   In each neighborhood, there are also checkpoints where people from other provinces must register.   Business trips, travel trips, and all other inter-provincial movements are restricted.     http://www.gov.cn/xinwen/2020-01/22/content_5471772.htm   pdf archive available upon request

On Jan 22, 2020, Wuhan Government announced that people were required to wear a mask in all public places. In other perfecture-level cities, there were no specific policies.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201101022848/http://www.xinhuanet.com/local/2020-01/22/c_1125495538.htm  https://archive.vn/23iqh

Coordinated public information campaign (e.g. official website and social media such as Weibo, WeChat) https://web.archive.org/web/20210314152619/http://www.hebwsjs.gov.cn/zwyw/360934.jhtml  From January 21, 2020, Health Commission of Hebei Province has released information and tips on COVID-19 prevention and control. https://archive.vn/4psY0

The first case (patient) was hospitalized due to fever and cough. Through the national and provincial CDC COVID-19 test, his result was positive.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210314152619/http://www.hebwsjs.gov.cn/zwyw/360934.jhtml

The first case (patient) who test positive was hospitalized due to fever and cough. Six close contacts in Hebei province have been placed under quarantine medical observation.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210314152619/http://www.hebwsjs.gov.cn/zwyw/360934.jhtml

Hainan reported its first imported case of covid-19 from Wuhan on Jan 22nd, 2020. Comprehensive contact tracing was initiated since then,  https://web.archive.org/web/20210620064513/https://baijiahao.baidu.com/s?id=1656417324109311061&wfr=spider&for=pc

On Jan 22, 2020, officials from the provincial education department visited some universities like Harbin Institute of Technology and Heilongjiang University of Chinese Medicine, giving instructions on epidemic prevent and control.     https://archive.fo/dOtrE

On Jan22, 2020, the provincial department of culture and tourism issued a notice on prevention and control of the epidemic, which pushed more strict measures like workplace closing in place later.   https://archive.fo/Ld4Iy

On Jan 22, experts from Heilongjiang Provincial Oral Disease Prevention and Treatment Institute reminded that wearing a mask was an effective means to block the spread of respiratory secretions, and choosing medical surgical masks can well prevent respiratory diseases.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210323123753/https://www.sohu.com/a/368450118_783931

On January 22, 2020, the Zhejiang Provincial Department of Transportation issued the "Emergency Notice on Effectively Preventing and Controlling Pneumonia Caused by New Coronavirus Infection" to provide on-site guidance on epidemic prevention work at stations and wharves.  See the Zhejiang Provincial Department of Transportation website, archived:   http://archive.today/2021.02.28-064538/http://jtyst.zj.gov.cn/art/2020/1/22/art_1676377_41807953.html

See the Zhejiang Provincial Department of Transportation website, archived:   http://archive.today/2021.02.28-064538/http://jtyst.zj.gov.cn/art/2020/1/22/art_1676377_41807953.html
Mass gatherings shall be reduced to the greatest extent.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200124234617/http://www.nhc.gov.cn/wjw/xwdt/202001/ad36526a13dd4c5e93ab9a9f8122ab7f.shtml

The government of Wuhan city announced in the evening on 22 January that citizens must wear masks when going to any public space. Anyone who does not follow the rule will risk violating the "P.R.China Contagious Diseases Act", the "Regulations on Hygienic Management in Public Places". For anyone who obstructs the emergency task force may violate the "Security Maintenance Penalty Regulations of the P.R.China" and commit a crime.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201019212041/http://www.xinhuanet.com/local/2020-01/22/c_1125495538.htm

The prevention and control of COVID-19 launched in Anhui Province from Jan 22, 2020.  The Health Committee of Anhui recommended to avoid public activities.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210207090833/http://ah.people.com.cn/n2/2020/0122/c358428-33737206.html

The prevention and control of COVID-19 launched in Anhui Province from Jan 22, 2020.  The Health Committee of Anhui recommended to avoid people gathering.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210207090833/http://ah.people.com.cn/n2/2020/0122/c358428-33737206.html

The Department of Transportation of Anhui Province requied all transport stations to examine body temperature of travelers and conduct daily disinfection.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210207091021/http://www.ahnews.com.cn/yaowen1/pc/con/2020-01/24/496_161537.html

The prevention and control of COVID-19 launched in Anhui Province from Jan 22, 2020.  The Health Committee of Anhui recommended to avoid public activities and stay at home.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210207090833/http://ah.people.com.cn/n2/2020/0122/c358428-33737206.html

The Department of Transportation of Anhui Province requied all transport stations to examine body temperature of travelers, conduct daily disinfection, and set special passage for vehicles from Wuhan.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210207091021/http://www.ahnews.com.cn/yaowen1/pc/con/2020-01/24/496_161537.html
The Health Committee of Anhui recommended all citizens to wear masks.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210207090833/http://ah.people.com.cn/n2/2020/0122/c358428-33737206.html

On Jan 23, 2020, the government of Beijing required public places to take active measures to prevent the spread of the epidemic.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210308104227/https://baijiahao.baidu.com/s?id=1656482289880864068&wfr=spider&for=pc

On Jan 23, 2020, the government of Beijing announced that all the public events were cancelled to prevent the spread of the epidemic.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210316032634/https://baijiahao.baidu.com/s?id=1656516531337700150&wfr=spider&for=pc

On Jan 23, 2020, although the government of Beijing recommended that people should reduce gatherings and public events were cancelled, there was still no specific limits on the number of people in gatherings.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210316032634/https://baijiahao.baidu.com/s?id=1656516531337700150&wfr=spider&for=pc

On Jan 23, 2020, the government of Beijing announced that active measures had been taken  to prevent the spread of the epidemic on buses, subways and airports, including limits on the full capacity, frequent disinfection and ventilation. However, since then, the public transport has never been totally closed.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210316053929/https://www.sohu.com/a/368635276_120209831

On Jan 23, 2020, the government of Beijing recommended that people should not go out if not necessary.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210308104227/https://baijiahao.baidu.com/s?id=1656482289880864068&wfr=spider&for=pc

From January 23, the departure of road and waterway passenger lines entering Wuhan will be suspended; inter-provincial and inter-city chartered passenger services entering Wuhan will be suspended; and other passenger lines passing through Wuhan will be immediately adjusted to detour, and picking up and getting off passengers in Wuhan is strictly prohibited.  http://web.archive.org/save/https://baijiahao.baidu.com/s?id=1656849490709040485&wfr=spider&for=pc

Guangdong had launched a first-level response to major public health emergencies and promptly introduced 16 prevention and control measures and a series of major measures, carrying out various prevention and control work in accordance with laws and regulations. Since January 24, Guangdong province suspended all kinds of large-scale mass activities, cultural centers, libraries, museums, art galleries, theatres, sports venues, etc.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210208030603/http://wsjkw.gd.gov.cn/zwyw_xwfbh/content/post_2879763.html

Guangdong Province recommended citizens stay at home, wear a mask when go out, and try not to have close contact with friends who come from Wuhan.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210208030603/http://wsjkw.gd.gov.cn/zwyw_xwfbh/content/post_2879763.html    Six new confirmed cases of pneumonia infected by novel coronavirus were reported in Guangdong Province. Among them: Zhongshan and Zhaoqing each had one case as the first confirmed case. Three new cases were confirmed in Guangzhou and one in Shenzhen in the other two cities.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210209034632/http://wsjkw.gd.gov.cn/zwyw_yqxx/content/post_2878571.html

On 23 January 2020, Department of Culture and Tourism of Gansu province required that cultural tourism units including cultural centers, libraries, museums, tourist attractions, etc., as well as cultural and entertainment places including internet cafes, song and dance entertainment places, and game amusement places should take effective prevention and control measures such as ventilation and disinfection.    https://archive.vn/W6zmp
On January 23, Gansu province was closed off and banned from gathering. See website, archived:  https://archive.vn/TKkUm

Since the first case of COVID-19 was reported in Gansu on January 23, close contacts have been tracked and medical observation has been carried out in the province. See website, archived:  https://archive.ph/1CUSx

All passenger service vehicles and tourist trips between Wuhan and Guangxi had been suspended. The provincial government urged relevant authorities to stay cautious about the public health risks in railway stations, airports, etc. Public health measures were also in place.     https://archive.ph/Gge4N

Henan provincial government advised people from Hubei to stay at home and reduce the time of going out everyday.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210223212421/http://wsjkw.henan.gov.cn/2020/01-23/1315283.html

On Jan 23, 2020, the provincial government of Hubei required that schools of all levels should postpone their starting date of the next semester.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210405160518/https://www.sohu.com/a/368717888_243614
Wuhan closes its ride-hailing services.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210809114237/https://www.whu.edu.cn/xxfy/info/1005/1052.htm

On January 23, 2020, Hubei Provincial Government cancelled all cultural activities, performances and tourism activities.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210406113901/https://baijiahao.baidu.com/s?id=1656567443737200850&wfr=spider&for=pc  http://web.archive.org/web/20210406114054/https://baijiahao.baidu.com/s?id=1656590237337982617&wfr=spider&for=pc
On January 23, 2020, Hubei Government requested the reduction of large-scale public gathering activities.  pdf archive available upon request

On Jan 23, 2020, 8 cities in Hubei Province, including Wuhan, Huanggang, Chibi, etc., announced to close public transport temporarily.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210403073159/https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/95A3Gj26IcRKbjLOgiM5pg

On Jan 23, 2020, 8 cities in Hubei Province, including Wuhan, Huanggang, Chibi, etc., announced to close public transport temporarily. Although the government didn't make specific polices about staying at home, people were recommended to stay at home.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210202094510/http://www.wh.gov.cn/zwgk/tzgg/202003/t20200316_972434.shtml

Wuhan Novel Coronavirus Pandemic Prevention and Control Headquarter issued the following policies:   In the city of Wuhan, all intra-city public transportation (bus, subway, ferry) is temporarily shut down. For inter-city transportation (airport and train), departure is temporarily closed.     http://www.gov.cn/xinwen/2020-01/23/content_5471751.htm   pdf archive available upon request

On January 23, according to the deployment of the State Council, the Ministry of Finance allocated an emergency subsidy fund of 1 billion yuan for the prevention and control of novel coronavirus pneumonia in Hubei Province to support the prevention and control of the epidemic.  https://archive.vn/zH8V8
On Jan 23, 2020, Hubei Government announced that all people in Hubei should wear a mask in public spaces.    https://archive.vn/w4Hxt

On Jan 22, 2020, Harbin education department issued an emergency notice, which required closing all kinds of kindergartens, all primary and secondary schools and all private cultural education training schools from Jan 23. The measures were in line with what the Ministry of Education required. Since universities had generally closed for winter holidays, no evidence suggested related measures were taken in place at that time.     https://archive.fo/sIsFI

Four notices were consecutively issued by Heilongjiang Province from Jan 23 to guide the masses to reduce outbound travel, which suggested that “recommend movement restrictions” was in place.    On Jan 23, Heilongjiang provincial health department issued a notice to strengthen the management of returning personnel from other provinces. Home medical observation and isolation were required but not that restricted.   https://archive.vn/to5LT  https://archive.vn/vupNh

On Jan 23, the second case was confirmed by the Heilongjiang Provincial Diagnostic Expert Group, while the day before, the first case was confirmed by the National Health Commission after tested. The difference between the confirming process suggested that no later than Jan 23, the provincial health institutions was capable of testing, but obviously at the beginning the testing was for the key people.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210316045320/https://www.fx168.com/fx168_t/2001/3578948.shtml  https://web.archive.org/web/20210316041421/http://wsjkw.hlj.gov.cn/pages/5f058765896eb30b540c2cb0  https://web.archive.org/web/20210316040913/http://wsjkw.hlj.gov.cn/pages/5f058765896eb30b540c2caf

Local media released instructions from experts, which recommended people to wear a mask under some circumstances like going to the hospital, taking public transportation, stay in a relatively closed or crowded space for a long time.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210323123802/https://m.dbw.cn/heilongjiang/system/2020/01/23/058323494.shtml

According to the official website of the Jilin Provincial Health Commission, on January 22, 2020, a suspected case returned from Wuhan in Changchun City was assessed and confirmed by the National Health Commission as the first confirmed imported Covid-19 case in Jilin Province. Medical observations have been carried out on close contacts.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210406134757/https://baijiahao.baidu.com/s?id=1656487436200715863&wfr=spider&for=pc

According to the official website of the Jilin Provincial Health Commission, on January 22, 2020, a suspected case returned from Wuhan in Changchun City was assessed and confirmed by the National Health Commission as the first confirmed imported Covid-19 case in Jilin Province. On the morning of January 23, the provincial government urgently held a video conference on the prevention and control of pneumonia caused by the new coronavirus infection in the province. On January 24, according to the Yunnan Provincial Public Health Emergency Response Plan, the provincial leading group for the prevention and control of pneumonia infected by novel coronavirus decided to start the first-level response to major public health emergencies in Yunnan Province.  In order to avoid cross-infection caused by the gathering of people and effectively protect the health and life safety of the people in the province, all kinds of large-scale activities (including permitted and voluntary activities) held during the Spring Festival in Yunnan Province will be cancelled from now on in accordance with the work deployment of the provincial Party committee, provincial government and the provincial leading group for epidemic prevention and control.   In order to do a good job in the prevention and control of novel coronavirus, many religious places and public places in Yunnan were temporarily closed or canceled. A number of well-known scenic spots in Yunnan have issued notices suspending the reception of tourists and many venues have also suspended their opening. There was no explicit policy on closing all but essential workplaces documented in writing, but one could infer a level 3 (require closing all but essential) policy was issued at some point at least in Wuhan since subsequent reopening policies required companies to apply in order to reopen.    Jan 26th is a good approximate because on this day Wuhan banned all vehicles on the road in the centre districts except when they transport essential goods, is related to government services, or are part of the limited public transport allowed to operate (probably for transporting key workers). This implies that very few could go to work from this day on, i.e. that there was likely a de facto workplace closure even if there was still no explicit policy in place.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210809115554/https://www.whu.edu.cn/xxfy/info/1005/1056.htm

According to the Jilin Provincial Department of Civil Affairs, since January 26, all 1,478 nursing homes have been closed for management. Each nursing home has only one entrance and exit. Special personnel are arranged to be on duty 24 hours a day. Outsiders are not allowed to enter. At the same time, family visits, external consultation and reception, and acceptance of new residents have been suspended. Strictly control the disinfection internally, and do a good job in comprehensive protection. Each elderly care institution conducts 3 body temperature checks, 2 indoor disinfection, and 1 comprehensive inspection of the elderly within one day. The internal staff of elderly care institutions should minimize going out. Those who must go out and return must monitor their body temperature and disinfect their clothes and accompanying items. As of February 16, 2020, there is no case of infection or suspected cases among 101,000 elderly people in 1,765 pension institutions in the province.  http://archive.today/2021.04.05-135031/https://www.guancha.cn/politics/2020_02_16_536665.shtml  http://archive.today/2021.04.05-141516/http://mzt.zj.gov.cn/art/2020/1/26/art_1632728_41860560.html

On 28 January, the National Health Commission issued the “Notice to Prevent and Control COVID-19 to Protect Elderly People.” In particular, this notice includes a letter to all senior citizens, which recommends them staying at home as much as possible; avoiding going to crowded public places; if public transport is unavoidable, elderly people should wear masks at all times and washing hands once get back home etc. This letter has altogether 12 advice. Accessible through the following link (I have included the archived version and the unarchived URL so that once can download the attachments).    This notice also includes a guideline for elderly care institutions. Measures include stop accepting new residents, reduce visitors, visitors are limited to designated areas, if elderly residents have been to epidemic areas, the institution should persuade them to suspend the plan for coming back to institutions, or should pass the quarantine period in designated sections before returning to normal living areas. On January 28, 2020, the People's Government of Yunnan Province issued 20 measures for the first-level response to major public health emergencies in Yunnan Province. Relevant measures are as follows:    1. The main and responsible leaders of Party committees and governments at all levels and related departments and units in charge of epidemic prevention and control have stopped their Spring Festival holidays and returned to work. Other staff members work from home and are encouraged to work online.    2. Suspension of chartered tourist buses to and from Yunnan.    3. Close public cultural venues, scenic spots and scenic spots, suspend the reception of tourist groups, suspend the formation and sending of tourist groups at home and abroad, suspend the holding of all kinds of large-scale activities and conferences, suspend the operation of movie theaters, singing and dancing entertainment venues, Internet cafes and commercial performance venues.    See the website of The Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China:  archived: https://archive.vn/RKXnU

On January 28, 2020, the People's Government of Yunnan Province issued 20 measures for the first-level response to major public health emergencies in Yunnan Province. Relevant measures are as follows:    1.Close public cultural venues, scenic spots and scenic spots, suspend the reception of tourist groups, suspend the formation and sending of tourist groups at home and abroad, suspend the holding of all kinds of large-scale activities and conferences, suspend the operation of movie theaters, singing and dancing entertainment venues, Internet cafes and commercial performance venues.    2.Collective dinners, large-scale trade fairs and mass activities in urban and rural areas have been suspended.    3.Service institutions for the aged and children's welfare are under closed management, and group activities are prohibited in service facilities for the aged. On 28 January, the National Health Commission issued the "Notice to Prevent and Control COVID-19 to Protect Elderly People." In particular, this notice includes a letter to all senior citizens, which recommends them staying at home as much as possible; avoiding going to crowded public places; if public transport is unavoidable, elderly people should wear masks at all times and washing hands once get back home etc. This letter has altogether 12 advice. Accessible through the following link (I have included the archived version and the unarchived URL so that once can download the attachments).  This notice also includes a guideline for elderly care institutions. Measures include stop accepting new residents, reduce visitors, visitors are limited to designated areas, if elderly residents have been to epidemic areas, the institution should persuade them to suspend the plan for coming back to institutions, or should pass the quarantine period in designated sections before returning to normal living areas. This attachment should be able to access through the unarchived version.   http://web.archive.org/web/20201214234528/http://www.nhc.gov.cn/lljks/tggg/202001/96e82ba8a14d41b283da990d39771493.shtml? Alternative archive: https://archive.vn/k9ZaE
Tuition centres are to suspend offline classes until further notice  https://archive.vn/TP8dE
Chongqing Railway Transit declared to take measures to reduce gathering and ask all passengers to wear masks in all public transport.  source:https://archive.vn/PYjDd
The government decided that citizens who went to Hubei during the spring festival holidays will not come back temporarily.  source:

The time for all kinds of enterprises to return to work shall not be earlier than 24:00 on February 9, 2020.  https://archive.ph/76FTq

On 29 Jan 2020, the Fujian Provincial Department of Civil Affairs formulated the "Guidelines for the Prevention and Control of Pneumonia Epidemic Caused by the Novel Coronavirus Infection in Elderly Care Institutions in Fujian Province (First Edition)".   The guideline clearly required that during the epidemic prevention and control period, the elderly care institutions shall implement fully closed management. The elderly care institutions would temporarily postpone the acceptance of new elderly residents, and suspend the reception of foreigners visiting and condolences, visit consultations, and visits; suspend all voluntary services and social practice activities; except for treatment of major diseases.     https://archive.vn/tGe86

All inter-province passenger service vehicles had been suspended. The number of inter-province trains was also reduced.    https://archive.ph/8NMjj
As of 29 January 2020, Guangxi's finance had dispatched a total of RMB 7.94 billion to cities and counties for treasury protection and epidemic prevention and control    link:https://archive.vn/9HPGH

On January 29, Hubei Provincial Civil Affairs Department announced that all LTCF for the elderly people should execute temporarily closed management, requring that:  1. Cancel all visits and gatherings. Relatives of their children are encouraged to use wechat, videos and phone calls to console the elderly. LTCFs are not allowed to accept new elderly residents before the epidemic is over.  2. Pay daily attention to the health conditions of elderly people. The body temperature of elderly people and staff should be measured twice a day; Windows should be opened regularly for ventilation, and hospital disinfection should be carried out regularly to maintain environmental hygiene in the institution.  3. Home care services for the elderly in urban and rural communities will be suspended. All home-based elderly care service organizations in the province should suspend door-to-door service projects for the elderly, and all street day care centers for the elderly, urban and rural community home care centers, meals for the elderly and other service facilities should be temporarily closed.  4. Strengthen personal protection for staff in elderly care institutions. Staff of institutions should strictly implement prevention and control systems such as disinfection and temperature measurement on their daily commute. Elderly care workers who have returned to work from middle-risk areas should be quarantined at home for 14 days.  https://archive.vn/n88Nr

In line with the relevant requirements of Yunnan Province to launch a level 1 response to major public health emergencies, Yunnan has partially suspended and adjusted public transport throughout the province.  On January 29, Kunming City Leading Group of Epidemic Work issued a notice, decided to suspend and adjust the urban public transport in the main urban area of Kunming. Part of the city's bus and rail transit lines were shut down, important stations and lines were preserved, and the operation time was shortened and the interval between trains extended.  During the period of epidemic prevention and control, public buses, subway trains and taxis (including online taxi hailing) temporarily kept in the city shall be strictly disinfected no less than twice a day, and the drivers shall wear masks before performing operational tasks. Passengers taking taxis (including online taxi) and buses should wear masks. Passengers on the subway should take their temperature and wear masks.  See the website of Yunnan Daily Nespaper: https://archive.vn/jEw2u

Although some places have stricter regulations on wearing facial masks in all the public spaces, the majority of cities require masks on in certain public spaces, mostly when using public transport. Places require masks in some public spaces include Chengdu city, Shenzhen city, Xi'an city, Zhengzhou city, Tianjin etc.     On 29 January, the National Health Commission host a press conference when the deputy director of the China CDC Feng Zijian suggested that there is no need to wear a mask whenever leaving the house. In situations of driving, staying alone, taking a walk and going to open spaces where is not crowded, it is fine to not wear a mask.     Given we are coding the most stringent policy in the country, therefore, I code "3" for strict places such as Wuhan and Guangdong, but "T" to reflect the regulations are not universally strict for the entire country.    Even if in practice Wuhan might be executing the stricter policy, which requires masks at all times outside the home, it is not formally required by any government document.     https://archive.vn/Cw0Z0

According to the instructions released by Heilongjiang Provincial Center for Disease Control and Prevention, NOT TO OVERPROTECT was the rule. Generally, when under circumstances like in an open place, alone, driving oneself or go for a walk in the park, and not have intensive contact with other people, the risk of infection was very low, and there was no need to wear a mask. However, wearing a mask was required when entering crowded or confined places and taking transportation. In non-epidemic areas, the public were recommended to wear disposable medical masks, while if in high-epidemic areas, wearing medical surgical masks was better.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210323123809/https://m.dbw.cn/jiankang/system/2020/01/30/058327767.shtml

Gansu province has hung propaganda slogans around the main roads of towns, villages and rural cultural activity rooms. And given full play to the role of rural radio to achieve comprehensive coverage. In major urban streets, communities, railway stations, airports and other public places, propaganda columns, television screens in buildings, outdoor electronic screens and electronic screens on car bodies have been used to guide the general public to respond to the epidemic in a scientific way, actively cooperate with the implementation of comprehensive prevention and effectively control the spread of the epidemic. See website, archived: https://archive.ph/yADPQ

The Guangdong Federation of Trade Unions issued the Action Plan for Care and Support of Guangdong Trade Unions for the Prevention and Control of Novel Coronavirus Infected Pneumonia, which clearly states that:    1. Medical care and disease control personnel in Guangdong Province who are infected with COVID-19 on the job will receive a one-time payment of RMB30,000 per person once they are confirmed;    2. If the direct family members (including parents, spouse and children) living with the medical and disease control personnel are confirmed to be infected, each of them will receive a one-time subsidy of RMB 5,000 (the total amount of assistance for each family relative is up to RMB 20,000).    https://archive.vn/PNx5z

On 1 February 2020, Lanzhou requires the closure of public places such as religious activities, entertainment places, culture, sports and tourism places. However, public places such as squares and small gardens can still be opened.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210806040211/https://www.sohu.com/a/370080059_100011426    Besides that, policy mentioned on 27 January 2020 are still valid    From 27 January 2020, Baiyin requires that public places that are not necessary for citizens' daily life should be completely closed.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210806031346/https://baijiahao.baidu.com/s?id=1656856006468544011&wfr=spider&for=pc    Gansu province required all cinemas within the province to close from 27 January 2020.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210806032604/https://baijiahao.baidu.com/s?id=1656876067867631036&wfr=spider&for=pc

On 1 February 2020, the provincial government required all schools and universities to delay the beginning of the new term. It also specified the tentative dates after which schools and universities would be allowed to open (17 February 2020 for schools and 24 February 2020 for universities, technical institutes,   and training institutes, etc).    https://archive.vn/XRdIv
The provincial government announced that all but essential sectors should delay reopening businesses until 9 February 2020 at 24:00.     https://archive.ph/DnwCD
Some counties required all intra-county public transport to be closed.     https://archive.ph/a7Trm    https://archive.ph/GSH7f

Hubei Novel Coronavirus Pandemic Response Team issued the following policies:   If someone wants to return to Hubei and Wuhan from other provinces, the company or neighborhood to which he/she belongs must make an application to the coronavirus response team at the destination city/county. If the application is approved, he/she can return.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210405130434/http://news.cnr.cn/native/gd/20200201/t20200201_524955498.shtml
Hainan announced on March 19th that no school was allowed to reopen until April 7th, 2020. Students in grade 9 and 12 are the first to return to schools.    https://archive.vn/3wHmb

As of February 1, the provincial medical insurance departments had prepaid 393 million yuan to medical institutions that undertake the task of treatment.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210316042301/https://www.hlj.gov.cn/zwfb/system/2020/02/02/010918794.shtml?ivk_sa=1023197a

On February 1, Jilin Province issued a notice stating that various enterprises will resume work no earlier than 24:00 on February 9. See media report, archived:    https://web.archive.org/web/20210217054933/https://china.huanqiu.com/article/9CaKrnKp8ZZ

For small and medium-sized enterprises and individual industrial and commercial households renting the operating houses of provincial state-owned units, the rent for February will be waived and the rent for March and April will be halved    Link: /web/20210313083121/http://czt.jiangsu.gov.cn/art/2020/3/11/art_7955_9008221.html

The financial support policy for epidemic prevention and control has been further improved. For the personnel who have direct contact with the cases to be investigated or confirmed, as well as the work related to the collection of samples of infection control cases and pathogen detection in the diagnosis and treatment nursing hospitals, a subsidy of 300 yuan per person per day will be given. Other medical personnel and epidemic prevention workers participating in the epidemic prevention and control will be given a subsidy of 200 yuan per person per day    pdf archive available upon request    Link: http://www.jiangsu.gov.cn/art/2020/2/1/art_60085_8958270.html

From 27th Jan to 30th Jan, all people who have come to Jiangsu from Wuhan, have been to Wuhan, and come to Jiangsu via Wuhan, please take the initiative to register with the community (village) committee as soon as possible, and take a temperature test. If there are no symptoms, it is best to conduct medical observation with family members at home for 14 days but no notification of testing. On February 3, 2020, Yunnan Provincial Department of Human Resources and Social Security issued a notice on the handling of labor relations issues during the epidemic prevention and control period    The circular pointed out the issue of subsidies for job stability. For enterprises participating in unemployment insurance that do not lay off employees or less, 50% of their actual unemployment insurance premiums paid in the previous year will be returned to them. Enterprises in poverty-stricken areas that have participated in unemployment insurance payments will be reimbursed at a rate of 60 percent.    For enterprises with temporary difficulties in production and management, the amount to be returned is determined by the average local unemployment insurance compensation of 6 months and the number of insured workers. The refunds will be mainly used for workers' living allowances, social insurance premiums, job transfer training, skills upgrading training and other related expenditures.    See the website of Yunnan Provincial Department of Human Resources and Social Security:  archived:https://archive.ph/8mLUd

Workplace shall not resume operation before midnight of 9 February in most provinces including Beijing, Guangdong, Jiangsu, Zhejiang, Shanghai, Ningxia, Shangdong, Shanxi, Inner Mongolia, Anhui, Yunnan, Heilongjiang, Liaoning, Hebei, Henan, Hunan, Jiangxi, Guangxi, Hainan, Fujian, Chongqing, Guizhou.   Resumption of individual workplace can be subject to further local approval. Guangdong lowers its requirement on masks on 5 February. It required wearing masks in all public spaces on 26 Jan, but from 5 Feb onward, citizens do not need to wear masks when in open space and keeping 2 meters distance to others, staying in office with good ventilation, driving or stay at home.   The general rule is in the first-class emergency response areas, masks are required in all public spaces.   In second-class emergency response areas, the targeted high-risk population group must wear masks, people in certain targeted high-risk places must wear masks, but in outdoor open spaces, citizens can choose to not wear a mask.  In the third-class class emergency areas, citizens should have masks prepared with them and should wear masks only in crowded, closed spaces, public transport and medical institutions such as hospitals.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201019222453/http://www.xinhuanet.com/2020-04/29/c_1125924570.htm  https://archive.vn/cbazy  http://web.archive.org/web/20201019222712/http://www.fogang.gov.cn/fgzx/zxyq/content/post_990556.html  https://archive.ph/3JhG2

(1)Support to negotiate salary for non-return period. During the period of delayed return to work or non-return to work affected by the epidemic, the enterprise shall pay wages in accordance with the standard stipulated in the labor contract within one wage payment cycle; For those who pay more than one wage period, the living expenses shall be paid at least 75% of the local minimum wage standard.  (2)Ensure the wages and benefits of employees. For COVID-19 patients, suspected patients and close contacts who cannot work normally due to isolation treatment, the enterprise shall pay their wages according to normal attendance during the isolation period; The workers who still need to stop working after the end of the quarantine period shall be paid according to the relevant provisions of the medical treatment period.  (3)For employees who cannot take a holiday during the extended Spring Festival holiday due to epidemic prevention and control, arrange compensatory leave or the salary will be paid no less than 200% of the employee's salary.

The Guizhou Development and Reform Commission issued “17 policies and measures to support service industry market players to actively respond to the pandemic.” According to the document, for employers in the service industry who lay off none or few employees, 50% of the unemployment insurance premium paid last year will be returned. The Guizhou Development and Reform Commission published “Notice on the implementation of supportive electricity price policy for enterprises during the period of pandemic prevention and control.” According to the document, for enterprises expanding production capacity to meet the needs of epidemic prevention and control, they need not to pay extra fees if they use more electricity than do their contracts entail; for enterprises that cannot open and resume work due to the pandemic control and lockdown, some basic electricity charges (starting from February 1, 2020) will be exempted. Additionally, from February to March of 2020, small and medium-sized companies that fail to pay electricity bill will not experience electricity shutdown. They can repay those electricity bills two months after the pandemic control ends, no extra fees collected due to payment delay.     PDF archive available upon request

1. Exemption of value-added tax for medical services provided by non-profit medical institutions such as designated medical institutions for Novel Coronavirus pneumonia; The preparations produced for their own use shall be exempted from value-added tax; To its self-use house property, land is exempt from levy house property tax, town land use tax  2. The health service income obtained by the disease control institution at the price set by the state shall be exempted from various taxes according to the regulations; To its self-use house property, land is exempt from levy house property tax, town land use tax.  3. Individual income tax shall be exempted for temporary work subsidies and bonuses obtained by medical personnel and epidemic prevention workers who participate in epidemic prevention and control work according to the standards set by the government. Government-stipulated standards include subsidies and bonus standards stipulated by governments at all levels.  4. For areas without access to the Internet, record TV classes or TV programs were alternative.    https://archive.fo/A23Fy
All schools in Hunan province close until 7th April.  https://archive.vn/qi5yb
Nearly 60 percent of enterprises in Shaanxi have not stopped work or have resumed work  https://archive.vn/wip/fqHAp

Basic living security for the unemployed: From January 1, 2020, those who are unemployed and have paid for at least one year but do not meet the conditions for receiving unemployment insurance compensation will be entitled to a monthly unemployment subsidy according to local unemployment insurance compensation standards until the end of the epidemic  https://archive.vn/wip/bJcNe

With the exception of inter-provincial and Wenzhou, Zhejiang Province removed all highway epidemic prevention checkpoints on February 19, and simultaneously reopend highway entrances and exits.  See the Zhejiang Provincial Department of Transportation website, archived:   http://archive.today/2021.02.28-070304/http://jtyst.zj.gov.cn/art/2020/2/19/art_1676891_41944397.html
Inter-province passenger service vehicles were now allowed to resume their businesses with strict public health measures in place.    https://archive.ph/714TS
As of February 20, provincial financial departments at all levels had raised 19.6 billion yuan for COVID-19 epidemic prevention and control.  https://archive.vn/6lnlZ

Hubei Novel Coronavirus Pandemic Response Team announced the following restrictions on LTCFs:  -LTCFs, which currently have elderly residents, cannot be used as quarantine facilities.  -LTCFs must be under strict close management. Food and other supplies bulk-bought by specialized purchasing personnel, so that the others don’t enter/leave the facilities.  - Current residents can’t leave without permission, and no new residents are allowed before the pandemic ends. Returning residents must be quarantined within the facilities for 14 days.  -Control and register all people entering/leaving the facilities - If there is any fever patient, the patient must be reported and sent to a specified hospital, and the close contacts must be sent to quarantine sites.   - Cancel all gatherings (food are delivered to each room) - People in the facilities must wear PPE - Regular sterilization and ventilation https://archive.fo/QKDXM

On Feb 20, there were news from Chinanews reporting that requirements of residents’ access to the community were still in place in Harbin. Except for special needs like going to work and seeing a doctor, each person was allowed to enter and exit once every two days.  https://archive.fo/tLM71
Lianyungang: Food export companies resume work and production one after another( up to date)  https://archive.vn/LvEBP
Ningxia donated 6 ventilators worth 215460 US dollars to 3 hospitals in Xiangyang City, Hubei Province.  source:https://archive.vn/dlg5j

On Feb 20, 2020, some tourist attractions were open, but the merchants were required to accomodate fewer than 9 people indoors.    https://web.archive.org/save/https://k.sina.com.cn/article_1887538377_70818cc901900kklq.html

Shandong Government issued a policy requiring all LTCFs to conduct closed management, which means all people in LTCFs were not allowed to exit, and all external visitors were prohibited to enter.   Archived:  http://web.archive.org/web/20210323122753/https://hm.baidu.com/hm.js?dcb9b74b5658af0f7b41f6ba4afb050c

On 20 February,2020, due to the limited medical and health conditions and poor natural environment in Tibet, strict measures have been taken to prevent and control the epidemic. The government indicated that under any circumstances, people who arrived in Tibet should be isolated for 14 days according to the regulations.See Tibet Government website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20210202134409/http://www.tibet.cn/cn/news/yc/202002/t20200220_6745595.html

On 21 February, the Business Management Department of the People's Bank of China took another initiative to actively organize financial institutions within its jurisdiction to improve the relief and assistance mechanism for special people affected by the epidemic, and introduced measures to delay repayment.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210322031857/https://www.sohu.com/a/375529513_100121052    On 21 February, Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development, Ministry of Finance of the People's Republic of China, and The People's Bank of China issued a notice, workers affected by the COVID-19 epidemic, if the housing provident fund loans cannot be repaid normally before June 30, 2020, will not be overdue, and will not be reported to the credit department as overdue records, and those that have been submitted will be adjusted. For employees who are under great pressure to pay rent, they can reasonably increase the amount of rent withdrawal and flexibly arrange the withdrawal time.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210322032346/http://www.mohurd.gov.cn/wjfb/202002/t20200221_244060.html

Liaoning switches to III tier response, i.e. residential compounds and villages are no longer closed. It has also employed the "Precise Response" model, where C6 orders would be issued to specific residential compounds/villages. Thus C6-regionwide will henceforward remain 0 as long as there is no shutting down of entire districts.

Liaoning now has 311 partner PCR test centres, and they are open to the public: https://archive.vn/qvHtj  But there is not enough evidence that there is the capacity to make PCR generally available, hence the coding of 2.

In terms of provincial boundary roads, we should do a good job in source control. According to the epidemic situation in surrounding provinces, we should reasonably set up provincial boundary epidemic prevention and control quarantine points or testing stations, and implement "two inspections and one test" for all personnel entering the Youth League, so as to prevent the epidemic from being imported through the provincial boundary. Inter provincial line and tourist charter passenger transport continue to be suspended, and other provincial line passenger transport is ready to resume operation at any time.    https://archive.ph/m7DkJ

The Guizhou government issues "24 policies on supporting enterprises to return to work and production and promoting migrant workers to return to work." According to the document, labor with employment difficulties, such as migrant workers, low-skill workers, and poverty-stricken workers, will receive an employment subsidy of 400 RMB (70 US dollars) per capita per month. The policy ends on 31 December 2020. PDF archive available upon request    Besides this policy, the government also provides one-time transfer payments to these workers, as well as monetary subsidies and tax credits to firms that hire and train these workers, to further improve their employment prospects. However, these policies do not influence the value of the indicator and are thus mentioned here.     PDF archive available upon request

The Guizhou General Office of Provincial People's Government published "Twenty four policies for supporting enterprises to return to work and production and promoting migrant workers to return to work," detailing policies that reduce/eliminate corporate social security taxes, as well as policies that reduce personal income taxes.     According to "Guizhou Government Report on Budget Implementation in 2020 and Draft on Budget in 2021," the province exempted 2185443634 dollars worth of income taxes, as well as 2372080492 dollars worth of social security taxes.     PDF archive available upon request

The Guizhou Healthcare Security Administration issued the “Notice on the pricing of covid-related medical services.” According to the notice, the maximum price (not including the price of the test kit) medical institutions can charge for the covid test is 65 RMB. Testing of key groups is paid by the government, while voluntary testing of people (not in key groups) is paid by tested individuals. The price for voluntary testing (including a test kit) is around 200-300 RMB.  At this point, testing is not yet publicly available both in terms of testing capacity (very few testing sites) and testing affordability (price is high).   https://archive.vn/aIVFh   (The original link is : http://www.guizhou.gov.cn/zwgk/zfxxgk/fdzdgknr/zdmsxx/ylws/202002/t20200224_51246203.html

On February 25, 2020, the Ministry of Culture and Tourism issued the Notice on the Work Guide for Restoring the Opening of Public Libraries and Cultural Centres (Stations). The Yunnan Provincial Department of Culture and Tourism coordinated the prevention and control of the epidemic and the resumption of work and production in the province's cultural and tourism industry in accordance with the instructions.    However, due to the needs of epidemic prevention and control, special personnel should be assigned to strictly manage all access channels and register those who enter public venues. Make sure that all visitors wear masks and have their temperature checked at the entrance. Only those with normal temperature can enter the museum.  Take measures to limit the flow of personnel. Each venue will implement real-name reservation service according to the situation, and the total number of daily visitors will be controlled according to the need of prevention and control work.  In principle, no offline activities such as lectures, training, performances and competitions will be held during the epidemic prevention and control period.    See the website of the Central People's Government:  Archived: https://archive.vn/jQkkl

On 27 February,2020, The people's Government of Tibet announced the following policies: first, for the insured enterprises with no or less layoffs, 60% of the unemployment insurance premium actually paid in the previous year would be returned. Second, enterprises that are temporarily difficult in production and operation but were expected to recover would be subsidized according to the monthly per capita unemployment insurance and the number of insured employees for six months. Third, from February 2020, the basic endowment insurance, unemployment insurance and work-related injury insurance of small and medium-sized enterprises would be exempted for no more than five months. Fourth, the payment of basic endowment insurance, unemployment insurance and work-related injury insurance of large enterprises and other insured units (excluding government organs and institutions) could be reduced by half, and the period of reduction should not exceed three months. Fifthly, enterprises with serious difficulties in production and operation affected by the epidemic might apply for a delay in payment of social insurance premiums. In principle, the period of delay should not exceed six months, and late payment fees should be exempted during the period of delay. See Tibet Government website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20210202123845/http://mw.xizang.gov.cn/xwzx/xzxw/202003/t20200320_134898.html

On 27 February, 2020, Tibet government issued a notice about several economic policies, for example, the government should give appropriate preference to the people who temporarily lost their source of income due to the epidemic, including flexible adjustment of personal credit repayment arrangements such as housing loans and credit cards, and reasonable extension of repayment period. The policy would last until 31 December, 2020. See Tibet Government website, archived:https://web.archive.org/web/20210202123845/http://mw.xizang.gov.cn/xwzx/xzxw/202003/t20200320_134898.html

On 27 February,2020, the government also fought against the epidemic through other fiscal means, such as giving preferential loans to key enterprises and delaying tax payment to enterprises seriously affected by the epidemic. See Tibet Government website, archived:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210202123845/http://mw.xizang.gov.cn/xwzx/xzxw/202003/t20200320_134898.html

On February 27, Zhejiang announced to implement a negative list system for resumption of work and production. According to the needs of epidemic prevention and control work, the public places and business industries that are on the negative list would be temporarily suspended or temporarily closed. The public places included in the negative list are mainly places where the space is relatively closed, people are relatively concentrated, and are not necessary for basic life. They include:    1.Convention and exhibition venues, theaters, performing arts venues, chess and card rooms, amusement halls, concert halls, shooting (arrow) fields, Internet cafes, KTV, dance halls, bars, public bathrooms, public swimming pools, foot bath shops, health massage shops, offline Service business establishments such as training institutions (adult and non-adult training).    2.Indoor tourist attractions, indoor venues in scenic spots, indoor stadiums, museums, libraries, art galleries, religious activities venues and folk belief activities that are likely to cause gathering of people.    See Zhejiang Daily website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210208143440/https://baijiahao.baidu.com/s?id=1659828401029587253&wfr=spider&for=pc

On March 18,  National Health Commission of the People's Republic of China issued a guidance on mask wearing. Medical masks and surgical masks are sufficient for normal use, and wearing multiple masks does not provide more protection, according to the guideline. The public is advised to carry along masks when in crowded places such as offices, shopping malls, restaurants, workshops and public transport. People in high-risk areas should wear surgical masks all the time when entering such places, while those in medium-risk and low-risk areas need to wear medical masks when in contact with others at the distance of less than 1 meter. Those who have cold symptoms such as coughing or sneezing, or who live with personnel in quarantine or that have recovered from the novel coronavirus and been discharged from the hospital, are suggested to wear disposable medical or surgical masks. People working in places such as hospitals, train terminals, airports, prisons and nursing homes need to wear surgical masks or respirators of grade KN95/N95 or above. The suspected cases, confirmed cases of novel coronavirus, asymptomatic cases and those who have close contact with confirmed cases are recommended to wear surgical masks or respirators with no breathing valve graded at KN95/N95 or above. Entry personnel need to wear such masks from the moment they enter the country to the end of their required quarantine.    See National Health Commission of the People's Republic of China website, archived:   http://archive.today/2020.10.19-223608/http://www.nhc.gov.cn/jkj/s3577/202003/0a472cc09e744144883db6a74fe6e760.shtml    See Zhejiang Daily website, archived:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210214055653/http://zjrb.zjol.com.cn/html/2020-03/19/content_3315711.htm?div=-1

Hubei Novel Coronavirus Pandemic Response Team announced the following policies about lifting traffic control in Hubei:   1.	Resuming rail transit in and out of the province. In all places other than Wuhan, all railway stations will open, both departure and arrival are allowed, and both passenger trains and cargo trains will operate.   2.	Resuming waterway transit in and out of the province. All (intra-provincial and inter-provincial) routes in low-risk areas return to normal operation. For Wuhan, passenger ships leaving Wuhan are still banned, but cargo ships leaving and entering Wuhan are allowed.   3.	Resuming air transit in and out of the province. In airports other than those in Wuhan, all cargo flights, as well as passenger flights except international and Beijing routes, return to normal operation.   4.	Resuming intra-city (not inter-cities) road transit within the province. In high-risk cities, all public transit runs at 30% capacity, and the maximum occupancy rate for each compartment is 50%. In middle-risk cities, all public transit runs at 50% capacity, and the maximum occupancy rate is 60%. In low-risk cities, all public transit, as well as other commercial vehicles that carry passengers, can return to normal operation.   http://www.hubei.gov.cn/hbfb/bmdt/202003/t20200326_2191483.shtml   pdf archive available upon request    Wuhan Bureau of Traffic and Transportation announced that 117 bus lines resume operation at 30% capacity.   The Bureau also announced a new policy concerning the use of public transit. Before taking public transit, residents must apply and obtain a “green code.” When taking public transit, passengers must scan a QR code (via Wechat or Alipay), so that the passenger’s use of public transit is recorded.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210405135037/https://baijiahao.baidu.com/s?id=1662197901999410800&wfr=spider&for=pc   https://web.archive.org/web/20210405135046/https://baijiahao.baidu.com/s?id=1661928626121562991&wfr=spider&for=pc

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the National Immigration Administration of the People's Republic of China issued an announcement on the temporary suspension of entry of foreigners holding valid Chinese visas and residence permits on March 26.    The suspension -- starting on Saturday Mar 28 -- is a temporary measure that China is compelled to take in light of the outbreak situation and the practices of other countries, the announcement said.  According to the announcement, entry by foreign nationals with APEC business travel cards will be suspended.  Policies including port visas, 24/72/144-hour visa-free transit policy, Hainan 30-day visa-free policy, 15-day visa-free policy specified for foreign cruise-group-tour through Shanghai Port, Guangdong 144-hour visa-free policy specified for foreign tour groups from Hong Kong or Macao SAR, and Guangxi 15-day visa-free policy specified for foreign tour groups of ASEAN countries will also be temporarily suspended.  Entry with diplomatic, service, courtesy or C visas will not be affected and foreign nationals coming to China for necessary economic, trade, scientific or technological activities or out of emergency humanitarian needs may apply for visas at Chinese embassies or consulates, the announcement said.  Entry by foreign nationals with visas issued after this announcement will not be affected.  See the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China website, archived:   http://archive.today/2020.07.28-032955/https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/web/wjbxw_673019/t1761858.shtml    As of that day, only a few international air routes were operating in Yunnan province, including Kunming - Vientiane, Bangkok, Xishuangbanna - Chiang Mai and Chiang Rai. All intercontinental air routes were suspended to prevent the import of the epidemic from abroad. According to "Notice on Implementing the Policy of Reducing and Exempting Property Tax and Urban Land Use Tax Affected by the Epidemic Situation," small and medium-sized enterprises that are affected by the pandemic can apply for the exemption of property tax and urban land use tax that should be paid in any two months in the first quarter of 2020, if they meet one of the the two criteria:  (1) Experience losses;  (2) Its cash flow is insufficient to pay taxes after the employers pay the wages and social insurance premiums to employees.    (Due to lack of document, the exact monetary value of cuts on property tax and land use tax are not separable from the total value of tax cuts. It is included in the value of E3 on 02/24/2020. )    PDF archive available upon request

In all places except Wuhan, roadblocks on highways, which prevent cars from leaving Hubei, start to be removed. Check-points are not removed, but cars can pass the check-points as long as all passengers have a “green code.”  At this point, Hubei has removed all sorts of traffic control (rail, waterway, air, and road) in places other than Wuhan.   http://www.hubei.gov.cn/hbfb/bmdt/202003/t20200326_2191483.shtml  pdf archive available upon request

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the National Immigration Administration of the People's Republic of China issued an announcement on the temporary suspension of entry of foreigners holding valid Chinese visas and residence permits on March 26.  The suspension -- starting on Saturday Mar 28 -- is a temporary measure that China is compelled to take in light of the outbreak situation and the practices of other countries, the announcement said.  According to the announcement, entry by foreign nationals with APEC business travel cards will be suspended.  Policies including port visas, 24/72/144-hour visa-free transit policy, Hainan 30-day visa-free policy, 15-day visa-free policy specified for foreign cruise-group-tour through Shanghai Port, Guangdong 144-hour visa-free policy specified for foreign tour groups from Hong Kong or Macao SAR, and Guangxi 15-day visa-free policy specified for foreign tour groups of ASEAN countries will also be temporarily suspended.  Entry with diplomatic, service, courtesy or C visas will not be affected and foreign nationals coming to China for necessary economic, trade, scientific or technological activities or out of emergency humanitarian needs may apply for visas at Chinese embassies or consulates, the announcement said.  Entry by foreign nationals with visas issued after this announcement will not be affected.  See the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China website, archived:   http://archive.today/2020.07.28-032955/https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/web/wjbxw_673019/t1761858.shtml

On 31 March, 2020, Yunnan Province issued a circular No. 15, and relevant measures are as follows:    1. Strictly control the movement of non-essential personnel in the border areas. All border counties and cities, border towns and villages (streets) and border villages (communities) in the province shall implement closed and grid management, strictly control the entry of outsiders, and encourage the general public to report illegal entrants.    2. Land ports are closed to persons from third countries. The issuance of entry and exit permits in border areas was suspended. Port travel was suspended.    3. Dissuade persons from neighboring countries (including border residents) from entering China through land and water ports and border residents' passageways.    4. Strict port and channel management. 19 land ports and 14 passageways will be suspended for passenger transport, while only cargo traffic will be retained. On 4 March, President Xi pointed out that the risk of epidemic spread of personnel mobility and aggregation is increasing, and prevention and control must be carried out with caution.   On 6 March, The People's Government of Tibet Autonomous Region decided to adjust the emergency response level of public health emergencies to level II, and some areas were managed according to level III.   However, the latest notice about the cancellation of public activities was not found, so it is reasonable to speculate that it will be the same as last month-2G. See several websites, archived:  https://archive.vn/wzRnd  https://archive.vn/om25i  https://archive.vn/3Vggj

On 31 January, 2020, The government of Tibet Autonomous Region proposed not to hold gatherings. After that, there was no more new policies about gathering, so it is reasonable to code 3G like the last month. The gathering was still under controlled at 50 people. See Tibet Government website, archived:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210202121732/http://www.xizang.gov.cn/xwzx_406/zwyw/202001/t20200129_131158.html

On 19 February, Tibet held the fourth press conference to guide people to go out less and not gather. Since then, this policy has been implemented in Tibet, suggesting that people stay at home as much as possible. See Tibet Government website, archived: https://archive.vn/NtSdn

On 27 January, Tibet set up an epidemic prevention and control leading group, launched secondary response to major public health emergencies, and advised people not to come to Tibet to block the channels of imported transmission. See China Tibet News website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200128105816/https://www.guancha.cn/politics/2020_01_27_533386.shtml  On 19 February, Tibet held its fourth news conference, saying that it would conduct 24h body temperature screening for people entering Tibet, strictly prevent and control the epidemic situation, and strictly implement the isolation policy. See Tibet Government website, archived: https://archive.vn/NtSdn  From 1 March to 15 April, there was no more other policies, so the coding is still 1G.

On 27 February, 2020, Tibet government issued a notice about several economic policies, for example, the government should give appropriate preference to the people who temporarily lost their source of income due to the epidemic, including flexible adjustment of personal credit repayment arrangements such as housing loans and credit cards, and reasonable extension of repayment period. The policy would last until 31 December, 2020. See Tibet Government website, archived:https://web.archive.org/web/20210202123845/http://mw.xizang.gov.cn/xwzx/xzxw/202003/t20200320_134898.html

The government fought against the epidemic through other fiscal means. For example, on 15 April, the Department of finance of the Tibet Autonomous Region has issued policies to support enterprises to resume work and production, including establishing green channels for purchasing, and giving priority to enterprises to resume work and production. See Ali Government website, archived: https://archive.vn/kZwnc

From 1 March to 15 April, Government of Tibet Autonomous Region launched coordinated public information campaign, like holding meetings and press conferences, and it also used telephone, television, Internet, and other media to strengthen the publicity of disease prevention knowledge among the masses. See several websites archived: https://archive.vn/EgvVI; https://web.archive.org/web/20210202125553/http://www.xzdyjy.gov.cn/folder967/yw/qnyw/2020-02-02/130072.html

On 19 February, Tibet held its fourth news conference, saying that it would conduct 24h body temperature screening for people entering Tibet, strictly prevent and control the epidemic situation, and strictly implement the isolation policy. See Tibet Government website, archived: https://archive.vn/NtSdn  From 1 March to 15 April, there is no clear policy to point out that nucleic acid testing is for everyone. However, it is reasonable to speculate that Tibet adopts a temperature screening and isolation policy for the people entering Tibet, and does not directly carry out nucleic acid testing. Therefore, nucleic acid testing should only be aimed at suspicious people, that is, people with new symptoms, so it should be 2.

On 12 February, 2020, the only confirmed case in Tibet was cured and left hospital. Since then, there have been no new cases in Tibet, so there are no trackable close contacts. However, according to the previous case detection, Tibet has the ability to track all close contacts. Therefore, it is recorded as 2. See Wuhan news website, archived: https://archive.vn/7F7ml

Sine the only case in Tibet was cured, the facial mask policy was lighted. See Eastday website, archived: https://archive.vn/VxQ9O
