Hubei has accelerated the work of COVID-19 nucleic acid testing service to meet the testing needs of the general public. Currently, the testing service network composed of 189 nucleic acid testing laboratories has covered the whole province. Hubei has taken nucleic acid testing as a key work at present, and strengthened nucleic acid testing services from the aspects of key population should be tested to the full, general population is willing to be tested to the full, timely improvement of testing capacity, specific objects to ensure that must be tested, and strengthening the management of testing reports.  Since March 30, the average daily number of nucleic acid tests in Hubei has reached 54,000, and on April 17, the number of tests reached 89,000.  Hubei province has carried out streaming and nucleic acid tests for teachers, medical staff, public transport service staff, public service staff in large shopping malls and other public places, prisons and pension institutions, and serum antibody tests for teachers and medical staff.  For cities besides Wuhan, Nucleic acid tests will be carried out for teachers and medical personnel. All other groups can accept  voluntary inspection.  https://archive.vn/532Lb  https://archive.vn/9b1Ng

https://web.archive.org/web/20200512042442/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-china/harbin-city-shuts-eateries-coronavirus-curbs-ease-elsewhere-in-china-idUSKBN22E07B  As of 2 May, Reuters.  “Harbin, the provincial capital of Heilongjiang and its biggest city, said it temporarily suspended dine-in services for all eateries, reported the official CCTV citing an emergency epidemic prevention notice.”  “While mainland China reported only one case on Saturday and crowds returned to some of its most famous tourist attractions for the 5-day May holiday, the northern province of Heilongjiang is hunkering down to prevent further clusters from forming.”  “The province has already banned entry to residential zones by non-locals and vehicles registered elsewhere. It had also ordered isolation for those arriving from outside China or key epidemic areas.”

On April 24, the Sichuan Provincial Department of Education issued the "notice on matters related to the opening of the spring semester of colleges and universities in 2020" (hereinafter referred to as the "notice"), making arrangements for the opening of the spring semester of colleges and universities in Sichuan Province in 2020. 12th May  China’s state-run benefit system covers only a small portion of the country’s unemployed. At a press conference held by the Joint Prevention and Control Mechanism of the State Council on the afternoon of May 17, Feng Luzhao, a researcher at the China Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, suggested wearing a mask in the following three situations:    One is to wear masks in relatively closed public places, such as public transportation, elevators, and crowded public places.    The second is to wear a mask when you are sick, especially when you have fever, cough and respiratory symptoms to avoid spreading to other people.    The third is to wear masks in certain environments such as hospitals.    Feng Luzhao also said that in the case of good ventilation and good and safe social distance, it is not necessary to wear a mask, such as parks, streets with fewer people, and playgrounds. Especially during strenuous exercise, you should not wear a mask. In addition, there is no need to wear masks in low-risk areas where no new cases have been reported recently.    https://archive.vn/CY1FJ

On May 21, the revised guideline on mask wearing was issued by National Health Commission of the People's Republic of China. It is applicable to low-risk areas. On 19 February, Tibet held the fourth press conference to guide people to go out less and not gather. Since then, this policy has been implemented in Tibet, suggesting that people stay at home as much as possible. See Tibet Government website, archived: https://archive.vn/NtSdn  The most serious situation in Tibet was in February, and there were no new cases since then. However, as the situation in the whole country is still severe, residents are still advised to stay at home and not go out.

On 27 February, 2020, Tibet government issued a notice about several economic policies, for example, the government should give appropriate preference to the people who temporarily lost their source of income due to the epidemic, including flexible adjustment of personal credit repayment arrangements such as housing loans and credit cards, and reasonable extension of repayment period. The policy would last until 31 December, 2020. See Tibet Government website, archived:https://web.archive.org/web/20210202123845/http://mw.xizang.gov.cn/xwzx/xzxw/202003/t20200320_134898.html

From 16 April to 31 May, there is no clear policy to point out that nucleic acid testing is for everyone. However, it is reasonable to speculate that Tibet adopts a temperature screening and isolation policy for the people entering Tibet, and does not directly carry out nucleic acid testing. See Centre People’s Government website, archived:  https://archive.vn/D2kpa  Therefore, nucleic acid testing should only be aimed at suspicious people, that is, people with new symptoms, so it should be 2.

On 12 February, 2020, the only confirmed case in Tibet was cured and left hospital. Since then, there have been no new cases in Tibet, so there are no trackable close contacts. However, according to the previous case detection, Tibet has the ability to track all close contacts. Therefore, it is recorded as 2. See Wuhan news website, archived: https://archive.vn/7F7ml

Sine the only case in Tibet was cured, the facial mask policy was lighted. The Guizhou Government issued “the Notice on the Implementation of Normalized Prevention and Control of Covid-19.”  According to the notice, for individuals coming from medium/high- risk regions or Wuhan:   If they have a “Green Code” and negative covid test result, they need to receive another covid test upon arrival and don’t need to quarantine. Those who tested positive would be sent under medical care. If they do not have a “Green Code” or negative covid test result, they need to quarantine in government facilities for 14 days regardless of their first covid test result upon arrival, after which they will receive a second covid test.   For individuals who have travel history from Hubei province (but not Wuhan): If they have a “Green Code” and negative covid test, they don’t need another test. If they only have “Green Code,” they will need to receive a covid test upon arrival.     http://www.guizhou.gov.cn/zwgk/zcfg/szfwj_8191/qfbfd/202006/t20200623_61204063.html   pdf archive available upon request

The Guizhou Government issued “the Notice on the Implementation of Normalized Prevention and Control of Covid-19.” According to the notice, foreigners exempted from the 3/28 ban, must quarantine for 14 days and get tested for covid in government facilities upon arrival. If they’ve quarantined in other places (Guizhou is their secondary destination), they need to be tested for covid.     http://www.guizhou.gov.cn/zwgk/zcfg/szfwj_8191/qfbfd/202006/t20200623_61204063.html   pdf archive available upon request

Guizhou Pandemic Response Office issued a “Notice on the implementation of ten normalized prevention and control measures during the pandemic.” According to the notice, key groups of people (who are at a higher risk of contracting the virus) must be tested, and medical institutions cannot refuse to test someone if the person demands a test. The government pays for the testing of key groups of people, whereas the employers/individuals pay for testing of all other people.     Although the notice ensures that people arriving at a testing site will be given a test, it does not ensures that everybody can easily receive a test: testing still costs hundreds (affordability problem), and there hasn’t been a testing site in every county (availability problem).     http://www.guizhou.gov.cn/zwgk/zcfg/szfwj_8191/qfbfd/202007/t20200720_61661497.html   pdf archive available upon request

Measures announced on Sunday for the Tianshan district of Urumqi included mass health screenings, and some public transport and most flights into the city were stopped on Saturday. Group activities have been suspended and people were warned against unnecessary travel outside the city. District authorities have also “strengthened [housing] compound management”, including tighter controls over who goes in and out, carrying out a comprehensive disinfection of the public areas of the community, providing contactless delivery services and help purchasing daily necessities. Beijing, meanwhile, has gone 14 days without a case of local transmission, and city authorities on Sunday said they were downgrading the emergency response level from 2 to 3. The move is largely symbolic, with many measures remaining in place including mandatory social distancing, temperature checks and 14-day quarantines for passengers arriving from abroad.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210810021145/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/jul/20/covid-19-outbreak-in-xinjiang-spreads-to-second-chinese-city

DALIAN, July 23 (Xinhua) -- The city of Dalian in northeast China's Liaoning Province reported two more confirmed cases of COVID-19 and another 12 asymptomatic cases on Thursday. The city has closed the factory and quarantined all its employees. Nucleic acid tests are being conducted on the company workers, facilities and surrounding areas. The Urumqi City Epidemic Prevention and Control Headquarters decided to gradually adjust the prevention and control policies of some COVID-free residential areas from August 23. The three main criteria to define a COVID-free residential area are: 1. there are no confirmed new cases, asymptomatic infections, and suspected cases. 2. all residents in the community were negative in the latest tests. 3. the area has high management standards and high-quality services. Residential areas in 6 districts are identified including all communities in the three districts (counties) of Dabancheng District, Urumqi County, and Ganquanbao Economic and Technological Development Zone and Midong District, Economic Development Zone (Toutunhe District), High-tech Zone (new urban area), Shayibake District, Shuimo.  Supermarkets, convenience stores, fruit and vegetable shops, etc., that provide residents with daily necessities in the small area can resume business to individual residents of the community within the specified time while doing epidemic prevention work.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200827224441/http://www.xj.gov.cn/info/10701/70013.htm

The policy issued on March 16, 2020 stay effective. In order to stabilize people's lives during the epidemic, Shandong Government issued a policy to provide a one-time living allowance to the unemployed people. The amount of subsidy is determined by each city. For example, Dongying City's subsidy amount is 491.56 dollars (3,438 yuan) per person, and Yantai City's subsidy amount is 579.06dollars (4,050 yuan) per person, both of which are paid at a time. The policy end date is December 31, 2020.   In addition, the policy extends the time limit for receiving unemployment insurance benefits. Theatres and other performance venues may hold commercial performance activities with the consent of the local Party committees and governments, but the holding of medium and large scale performance activities and the newly approved commercial performance activities involving foreign countries, Hong Kong, Macao and Taiwan (except for those whose performers and performers are already in China) shall be suspended.In the restored performance venues, personnel reservation and flow restriction measures should be strictly implemented. On September 23, 2020, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs issued a notice that foreigners who hold valid Chinese residence permits for work, private affairs and reunion will be allowed to enter China from 0 am on September 28, 2020. They do not need to apply for a new visa. If the above three types of residence permits held by foreigners expire after 0:00 on March 28, 2020, holders can apply for corresponding visas to Chinese embassies or consulates abroad with the expired residence permits and relevant documents under the condition that the purpose of coming to China remains unchanged. The above-mentioned personnel should strictly abide by China's regulations on epidemic prevention and management.  Other measures announced on March 26 remain in place. China will gradually and orderly resume personnel exchanges with other countries on the premise of ensuring epidemic prevention and security.    See the website of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs:  archived: http://archive.ph/2020.09.26-102330/https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/web/wjbxw_673019/t1817369.shtml

The new policy allows foreigners holding working visas, family visas or visiting visas (not tourist visas) to enter China without re-applying for new visas. However, the announcement also confirms other restrictions contained in the 26 March announcement stay unchanged. China allows the entry of foreign nationals holding three categories of valid Chinese residence permits starting on September 28, according to an announcement jointly made by the Foreign Ministry and the National Immigration Administration.  foreigners who hold valid Chinese residence permits for work, private affairs and reunion will be allowed to enter China from 0 am on September 28, 2020. They do not need to apply for a new visa. If the above three types of residence permits held by foreigners expire after 0:00 on March 28, 2020, holders can apply for corresponding visas to Chinese embassies or consulates abroad with the expired residence permits and relevant documents under the condition that the purpose of coming to China remains unchanged. The above-mentioned personnel should strictly abide by China's regulations on epidemic prevention and management.  Other measures announced on March 26 remain in place. China will gradually and orderly resume personnel exchanges with other countries on the premise of ensuring epidemic prevention and security.    See the website of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs:  archived: http://archive.ph/2020.09.26-102330/https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/web/wjbxw_673019/t1817369.shtml

China allows the entry of foreign nationals holding three categories of valid Chinese residence permits starting on September 28, according to an announcement jointly made by the Foreign Ministry and the National Immigration Administration.  The new rule allows foreign nationals holding valid Chinese residence permits for work, personal matters or reunions to enter China without applying for new visas, said the announcement.  It also said that if the three categories of residence permits held by foreign nationals expired after midnight on March 28, the holders may re-apply by presenting the expired residence permits and relevant materials to the Chinese embassy or consulate on the condition that the purpose of their visit to China remains unchanged.  While ensuring effective epidemic control, the Chinese government will continue resuming people-to-people exchanges in an orderly manner.  See the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China website, archived:   http://archive.today/2020.09.26-102330/https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/web/wjbxw_673019/t1817369.shtml

The COVID-19 vaccination program was first launched in Zhejiang in October 2020. Jiaxing, Yiwu, Shaoxing and other places have announced that the key group can be vaccinated. The emergency vaccination should be carried out according to the principle of priority of key group, priority of epidemic area, safe vaccination and informed voluntary. The key protection objects include medical personnel, health and epidemic prevention personnel, etc. The key recommended objects include those who go to high risk countries and regions to engage in public affairs, etc. The age range of vaccination is 18-59. The COVID-19 vaccine needs to be vaccinated twice, with an interval of 14-28 days. The recommended interval is 28 days. The price of the vaccine is 200 yuan per dose, with a total of 400 yuan per dose.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210330045350/https://baijiahao.baidu.com/s?id=1694296294623884668&wfr=spider&for=pc

On June 4, 2020, the Shandong Provincial Department of Transportation issued a policy announcing that the epidemic prevention and control of public transportation in Shandong Province has entered the normalization stage. This means that for low-risk areas, urban public transportation has returned to normal (but disinfection is required and passengers are required wear masks). For medium- and high-risk areas, stricter epidemic prevention measures like reducing volume are required, but there is no clear requirement to close public transportation. In this period, there was no medium- or high-risk areas in Shandong. See website of Shandong Provincial Department of Transportation, archived:  http://web.archive.org/save/http://jtt.shandong.gov.cn/art/2020/6/4/art_100501_9179405.html
During this period of time, Shandong has no more middle-risk areas and high-risk areas.

On November 2, 2020,  the People's Government of Yunnan Province issued a notice, saying that in the face of the sudden COVID-19 epidemic, the provincial civil affairs department has fully implemented the assistance and support system and temporary assistance system for people in extreme poverty. From January to September, a total of 1.177 billion yuan in temporary price subsidies were provided to urban and rural subsistence allowance recipients, people living in extreme poverty and other low-income groups, benefiting 24.5344 million people in need, with an average monthly subsidy of 48 yuan per person. The province spent a total of 6.78 billion yuan to help people in need.    Since October, provincial civil affairs departments have launched a decisive battle against poverty. If the per capita income exceeds the rural subsistence allowance standard, a gradual phase-out period of six months to one year may be granted to implement the gradual phase-out of the assistance.    See the website of People's Government of Yunnan Province:  archived: https://archive.ph/Tsq8i

The Ministry of Civil Affairs has drawn up three guidelines for the use of local civil affairs departments to better prevent and control epidemic in elderly care institutions. The guidelines are ‘The Guidelines for Normalized Prevention and Control of Covid-19 in Elderly Care Facilities,’ ‘The Guidelines for Prevention and Control of Covid-19 in Elderly Care Facilities for Regions with Sporadic Cases,’ and ‘The Guidelines for Prevention and Control of Covid-19 in Elderly Care Facilities in High-Risk Regions.’ Here, we code according to the policies stated in ‘The Guidelines for Normalized Prevention and Control of Covid-19 in Elderly Care Facilities’ because this guideline is effective on a national level.       According to the guidelines, care facilities are required to: 1) record the information of visitors and ban visitors coming from high-risk regions, 2) give covid test to elderly returning from high-risk regions, 3) clean and sanitize daily, 4) conduct temperature tests on elderly daily.     https://archive.vn/DEUIZ

It is clear that due to the impact of the epidemic situation, the employing unit should handle the business of employee insurance registration and payment within the time limit, and the agency should accept it in time and handle it properly. Flexible employment personnel and urban and rural residents will be allowed to make one-time or regular payment of social insurance premiums in 2020, and the time limit will be relaxed. If they fail to make timely payment for insurance, they will be allowed to make a good record of business accounts and make up after the end of the epidemic. Overdue payment does not affect the personal rights and interests records of the insured, and the supplementary procedures can be completed within 3 months after the lifting of the epidemic.  source:https://archive.vn/mlyfL

In order to stabilize people's lives during the epidemic, Shandong Government issued a policy to provide a one-time living allowance to the unemployed people. For example, Dongying City's subsidy amount is 491.56 dollars (3,438 yuan) per person, and Yantai City's subsidy amount is 579.06dollars (4,050 yuan) per person, both of which are paid at a time. The policy end date is December 31, 2020.   In addition, the policy extends the time limit for receiving unemployment insurance benefits. This extended note aims to capture the progress on vaccination programme before it is rolled out to the entire country (does not include R&D, clinic trials).    The China National Medicine Products Administration (MPA) has not formally approved the Sinopharm Inactivated vaccine to go to the market. However, the green light is anticipated in the next few days.     http://web.archive.org/web/20201214212000/https://weareunited.com.my/11515744/    On 24 June 2020, the MPA approved the emergency use of COVID-19 vaccine. Voluntary vaccination started on around 17 June. The first batch of receivers consisted mainly of key workers, including state-owned enterprise employees who must go overseas to countries where the pandemic hits hard; medical staff, epidemic-control staff, border force and other essential workers who keep cities running.     http://web.archive.org/web/20201214231804/https://finance.sina.com.cn/chanjing/cyxw/2020-11-18/doc-iiznezxs2537217.shtml    From mid-October, Zhejiang province has offered vaccines to ordinary citizens on a voluntary basis. The rationale has been that many cities in Zhejiang have export-oriented economies; for example, Yiwu city is the world centre for light industry commodity trading. Many wholesale merchants were keen on receiving vaccines so that they can travel to Latin America and Africa to inspect their businesses. See BBC reports below. By mid-November, Zhejiang had provided vaccines to some 743,000 people. Voluntary vaccines were paid by recipients. Two doses cost roughly 400 CNY plus a service charge of around 56 CNY, which altogether equals to approximately 70 USD.     http://web.archive.org/web/20201214231741/https://www.bbc.com/zhongwen/simp/chinese-news-54628714    As the vaccination programme is yet to roll out to the whole country, there is no national policy on who will get the vaccine first. However, Sichuan province, where the most recent cluster of infection was found, did publish a detailed plan to that sets out the order:    The first group to receive vaccines consists of people facing high risks of infection, including medical staffs with International assistance mission, national health emergency rescue team in Sichuan, fever clinic and frontline doctors and nurses, border control force, frontline health inspection and epidemic-control officials, students or workers going overseas, police force, frozen food industry workers, essential workers for keeping cities running, teachers, other medical staffs, doctors and nurses, community social workers. The first batch is estimated to have 2 million people. Vaccination for them has started and will finish within 2020.    The second group to receive vaccines mainly consists of vulnerable people, including elderly people and people with chronic diseases. Vaccination for them will start from early next year (January).    The third batch will open to the general public. Ordinary people are estimated to start receiving vaccines after the Chinese New Year (12 February 2021).    http://web.archive.org/web/20201214221555/https://www.sohu.com/a/437018675_114988    So far, vaccination is not and is unlike to be paid by social medical insurance funds in the future. The National Health Security Administration has cited laws and regulations as the justification that vaccination is a part of public health effort, which should be shouldered by public finance resources, rather than social medical insurance funds.     http://web.archive.org/web/20201214211226/https://www.sohu.com/a/425495553_114986    UAE and Bahrain have formally approved the Sinopharm vaccine on 9th and 13th December 2020 respectively.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201214231619/http://www.xinhuanet.com/2020-12/09/c_1126842251.htm  http://web.archive.org/web/20201214231549/http://www.xinhuanet.com/world/2020-12/14/c_1126855787.htm
There is no change in the policy

Groups B and/or C will be the next to be vaccinated.    https://archive.vn/oG1an

As of December 29, a total of 85,000 people have been vaccinated in Fujian province, no serious adverse reactions have occurred, and the overall situation is stable and orderly.    https://archive.vn/GbKv6    Since 23 Dec 2020, Fujian Province started giving vaccine to both key workers and clinically vulnerable groups, the vaccines are Sinopharm Beijing, Sinopharm Wuhan and Sinovac. Sinopharm Beijing has received formal conditional approval from the National Medical Product Administration since 30 Dec 2020, whereas Sinovoc has not until 6 Feb 2021 and Sinopharm Wuhan has not until 25 Feb 2021. So, between these dates, unavoidably some vaccines administrations were given under the emergence use regulation. But the mixed usage of the three vaccines makes it impossible to separate the population groups receiving them.

As of December 29, a total of 85,000 people have been vaccinated in Fujian province, no serious adverse reactions have occurred, and the overall situation is stable and orderly.    https://archive.vn/GbKv6    Since 23 Dec 2020, Fujian Province started giving vaccine to both key workers, the vaccines are Sinopharm Beijing, Sinopharm Wuhan and Sinovac. Sinopharm Beijing has received formal conditional approval from the National Medical Product Administration since 30 Dec 2020, whereas Sinovoc has not until 6 Feb 2021 and Sinopharm Wuhan has not until 25 Feb 2021. So, between these dates, unavoidably some vaccines administrations were given under the emergence use regulation. But the mixed usage of the three vaccines makes it impossible to separate the population groups receiving them.

A: Sinovax  The COVID-19 vaccination program was first launched in Zhejiang in October 2020. Jiaxing, Yiwu, Shaoxing and other places have announced that the key group can be vaccinated. The emergency vaccination should be carried out according to the principle of priority of key group, priority of epidemic area, safe vaccination and informed voluntary. The key protection objects include medical personnel, health and epidemic prevention personnel, etc. The key recommended objects include those who go to high risk countries and regions to engage in public affairs, etc. The age range of vaccination is 18-59. The COVID-19 vaccine needs to be vaccinated twice, with an interval of 14-28 days. The recommended interval is 28 days. The price of the vaccine is 200 yuan per dose, with a total of 400 yuan per dose.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210330045350/https://baijiahao.baidu.com/s?id=1694296294623884668&wfr=spider&for=pc  http://web.archive.org/web/20210604100137/https://www.chinanews.com/gn/2021/01-15/9388437.shtml  http://web.archive.org/web/20210604100211/https://zj.zjol.com.cn/news/1598027.html  http://web.archive.org/web/20210604100542/https://www.guancha.cn/politics/2020_10_17_568374.shtml  http://web.archive.org/web/20210604100549/https://www.bbtnews.com.cn/2020/1022/373262.shtml

A-key workers  On January 17, 2021, the Jilin Provincial Health Commission held a press conference to announce that Jilin Province is organizing the new crown vaccination work for key populations,including A and B. Currently, there are five types of key populations vaccinated against the new crown: First, the port line of imported cold chain goods Customs inspection and quarantine personnel, port loading and unloading, handling, transportation and other related personnel; second, international and domestic transportation personnel; third, personnel working and studying abroad for business or private purposes, and border port staff who are facing a higher risk of overseas epidemics; The fourth is medical and health personnel; the fifth is urban operation guarantee personnel.     Jilin Province has carried out the new crown vaccine for key populations on a voluntary and free principle. The vaccinated population should be between 18-59 years old and there is no contraindication to vaccination. Currently, Jilin Province has raised 177 million yuan in funds to purchase the new crown vaccine and has ordered 1.324 million doses. A support mechanism for medical institutions and vaccination units above the second level has been established to ensure vaccination safety, and vaccination work is proceeding in an orderly manner.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210604093521/https://baijiahao.baidu.com/s?id=1689294564763295055&wfr=spider&for=pc  https://web.archive.org/web/20210406123753/https://baijiahao.baidu.com/s?id=1689294564763295055&wfr=spider&for=pc

Existing policy remains effective.   Since December 1, 2020, all persons (including Chinese nationals) traveling from abroad to destinations in Mainland China must have proof of dual negative results for COVID-19 using both a nucleic acid test and an IgM antibody test. Both tests must be performed no more than 48 hours prior to departure and results must be submitted for approval to a local Chinese embassy or consulate. All persons must undergo a 14-day quarantine at a designated location upon arrival in Mainland China.  Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20210210153153if_/https://www.trip.com/travel-restrictions-covid-19/  http://web.archive.org/web/20210215064956/http://www.china-embassy.org/eng/notices/t1834822.htm   http://web.archive.org/web/20201124034212/http://www.china-embassy.org/eng/notices/t1831292.htm

Sinopharm Beijing has received formal conditional approval from the National Medical Product Administration since 30 Dec 2020, whereas Sinovoc has not until 6 Feb 2021 and Sinopharm Wuhan has not until 25 Feb 2021. So, between these dates, unavoidably some vaccines administrations were given under the emergence use regulation. But the mixed usage of the three vaccines makes it impossible to separate the population groups receiving them.

See the website of People's Government of Yunnan Province.  archived: https://archive.vn/7OxRM    According to the directive of the National Health Council, the policy will be implemented from January 28 to March 8    See the website of National Health Commission:  archived:  https://archive.vn/nss2b

On January 21, 2021, the People's Government of Yunnan Province issued a notice, requiring people returning home from other provinces during the Spring Festival to hold a negative nucleic acid test certificate, and to conduct home quarantine and health monitoring for 14 days after returning home, with no aggregation or movement during the period.  See the website of People's Government of Yunnan Province:  archived:  https://archive.vn/7OxRM    According to the directive of the National Health Council, the policy will be implemented from January 28 to March 8.  See the website of the National Health Commission:  archived:  https://archive.vn/a4yA9

As of 18:00 on February 4, a total of 809,941 new crown vaccines have been vaccinated in Fujian, which is generally stable and orderly.    https://archive.vn/Lo3zz    Since 23 Dec 2020, Fujian Province started giving vaccine to both key workers, the vaccines are Sinopharm Beijing, Sinopharm Wuhan and Sinovac. Sinopharm Beijing has received formal conditional approval from the National Medical Product Administration since 30 Dec 2020, whereas Sinovoc has not until 6 Feb 2021 and Sinopharm Wuhan has not until 25 Feb 2021. So, between these dates, unavoidably some vaccines administrations were given under the emergence use regulation. But the mixed usage of the three vaccines makes it impossible to separate the population groups receiving them.

Provincial Party committee announced, through Hubei Daily Press, the policies concerning people returning to their hometowns during the 2021 Spring Festival:  -	Besides workers in cold chains and medical personnel in hospitals receiving covid/fever patients, all people living in Hubei can move within the province if they have a “green code.” No quarantine is needed. -	If people from low-risk provinces want to move into Hubei cities, they must have a “green code” and show their “travel pass” (the travel pass shows places they’ve been to in the past 14 days). No quarantine is needed. -	If people from low-risk provinces want to move into Hubei rural areas, they must have a “green code,” show their “travel pass,” and have a negative covid test result. No quarantine is needed.   http://hbrbshare.hubeidaily.net/hbshare/news/detail_index.html?contentType=5&contentId=781285&cId=0  pdf archive available upon request

During the Spring Festival, Gansu asked residents to pay attention to personal protection, maintain a safe social distance, wear masks, and develop good hygiene habits such as frequent hand washing and frequent ventilation. The majority of workplaces had reopened with public health measures in place.     https://archive.vn/yhLRY

It is clear that due to the impact of the epidemic situation, the employing unit should handle the business of employee insurance registration and payment within the time limit, and the agency should accept it in time and handle it properly. Flexible employment personnel and urban and rural residents will be allowed to make one-time or regular payment of social insurance premiums in 2020, and the time limit will be relaxed. If they fail to make timely payment for insurance, they will be allowed to make a good record of business accounts and make up after the end of the epidemic. Overdue payment does not affect the personal rights and interests records of the insured, and the supplementary procedures can be completed within 3 months after the lifting of the epidemic.  source:https://archive.vn/mlyfL

Taking into account that the risk of the epidemic still exists, some companies may be under greater pressure. After the policy of phased reduction of unemployment insurance and work-related injury insurance rates expires at the end of April this year, it will be extended for another year to April 30, 2022. https://archive.fo/wip/3fFsI

People coming to Gansu from medium-risk areas outside the province should have a "green code" health code and a negative nucleic acid test certificate within 72 hours, then have home health monitoring for 14 days. Since December 1, 2020, all persons (including Chinese nationals) traveling from abroad to destinations in Mainland China must have proof of dual negative results for COVID-19 using both a nucleic acid test and an IgM antibody test. All persons must undergo a 14-day quarantine at a designated location upon arrival in Mainland China. From March 10, elderly care institutions resume visitation services, and can accept newly admitted senior citizens and new employees, and senior citizens and employees who leave the institution during the Spring Festival can return to the hospital. Family members can be admitted to the institution to visit the elderly within a limited time, number of people, routes, and areas (not entering the living area) after advance appointment, real-name registration, and green-code temperature measurement. They should wear masks throughout the visit and comply with the epidemic  prevention and control requirements.   See Department of Civil Affairs of Guangdong Province website, archived:   http://archive.today/2021.04.10-044248/http://smzt.gd.gov.cn/zwzt/yqfk/smztdt/content/post_3238889.html

According to "Fujian New Coronavirus Vaccination Work Plan" interpreted by The Fujian Provincial Health Commission, by the end of June, key workers are still given priority for vaccination. Elderly groups and others would be included after the vaccine safety further improved.    Since 23 Dec 2020, Fujian Province started giving vaccine to both key workers and clinically vulnerable groups, the vaccines are Sinopharm Beijing, Sinopharm Wuhan and Sinovac. Sinopharm Beijing has received formal conditional approval from the National Medical Product Administration since 30 Dec 2020, whereas Sinovoc has not until 6 Feb 2021 and Sinopharm Wuhan has not until 25 Feb 2021. So, between these dates, unavoidably some vaccines administrations were given under the emergence use regulation. But the mixed usage of the three vaccines makes it impossible to separate the population groups receiving them.

Large-scale population vaccination in Shanxi Province will be carried out from May to June. By the end of June, 14.91 million people will be vaccinated with nearly 30 million doses. On the basis of the previous ten categories of occupational exposure risk population vaccination work, in the near future, the vaccination work will be promoted in key regions, key populations, and key industries.    The key areas mainly refer to large and medium-sized cities and port cities, where people over 18 years of age in the above areas "should take all of them." Key workers include government agencies, enterprises and institutions, students and faculty of institutions of higher learning, and service personnel of large supermarkets, etc., and vaccinations have been steadily promoted for people over 60 years of age. Due to the local COVID-19 epidemic in Ruili City, since March 31, all urban schools in Ruili City have been closed, and residential students in urban boarding schools have been kept in school for closed isolation management.    As of 8 o 'clock on March 31, the city involved in the suspension of 52 schools, involving 32,252 students and 2,315 staff. All teachers and students involved in the suspension of classes will be quarantined at home to reduce staff turnover and arrange students to study at home in a timely manner.    See the website of Ruili City People's Government:  https://archive.vn/D6zRO

On March 31, 2021, Ruili City COVID-19 epidemic prevention and control headquarters issued a circular, the relevant measures are as follows:    1. All residents in the urban area will be quarantined at home for one week, and they are not allowed to go out without special reasons. People who need to go out under special circumstances can only go out with the permission of the community they are in.    2. During the period of domestic quarantine, all business premises except supermarkets, pharmacies and farmers' markets shall be closed. The resumption time of various business sites and trades shall be separately notified by the municipal headquarters.    See the Website of Renmin Newspaper:  https://archive.vn/B25s9

From January 1, 2021, Jiangxi Province requires all persons entering and exiting key places and public places to wear disposable medical or surgical masks, take temperature measurements, and scan health codes. On March 31, Jiangxi Province issued a risk reminder, hoping that the general public will always maintain their personal protection awareness, develop masks to be carried with them, and wear masks scientifically (especially when taking public transportation and activities in public places).    https://archive.vn/QQt5G

On March 31, Jiangxi Province issued a risk alert, hoping that the general public will always maintain a sense of personal protection, develop good hygiene habits such as carrying masks with them, and maintaining safe social distancing.    https://archive.vn/QQt5G

On July 21, 2021, Jiangxi Province issued a policy to help enterprises and individual industrial and commercial households lose weight and reduce taxes. Since then, no relevant policies have been introduced to reduce taxes for ordinary residents.    https://archive.vn/aU4s5
During this period, Jiangxi Province has achieved good results in epidemic prevention and control, and there is no special financial fund for epidemic prevention and control.
During this period, Jiangxi Province did not provide overseas financial assistance.

The epidemic prevention and control information in Jiangxi Province has always been controlled by the official media, and the private sector has no media with greater influence. The Jiangxi Provincial Government’s official website has set up a special column to release epidemic information.     https://archive.ph/cSTgv

During this period of time, epidemic prevention and control in Jiangxi Province became normal. If symptoms of respiratory tract infection such as fever, sore throat, cough, etc. occur, go to the nearest medical institution in time under the premise of personal protection.    https://archive.ph/SfTmQ

On March 26, a new confirmed case in Jiangxi was transferred to a designated hospital for observation and treatment in a closed loop, and at the same time, close contacts were quickly investigated and controlled.    https://archive.vn/HqtgG
During this period, Jiangxi did not use funds for epidemic prevention and control relief.
The Jiangxi Provincial Government has no special expenses for vaccine research and development.

On March 31, Jiangxi Province issued a warning that the Ching Ming Festival is approaching. Since 12 April, Hong Kong and Macao people in Shanghai can make an appointment for COVID-19 vaccination.   People from Hong Kong and Macao who work and live in the mainland can receive free vaccination with their Hong Kong and Macao residence ID card or their mainland medical insurance certificate. Students from Hong Kong and Macao who study and work in the mainland are also eligible for free vaccination. Other people from Hong Kong and Macao who do not fall into the above two categories can receive vaccination at a cost of 100 yuan per dose. See government website, archived: https://archive.vn/J9wK2

On April 29, the epidemic prevention and control headquarters of Ruili City issued a notice on the adjustment of the epidemic risk level, which means there is no high-risk area in Ruili.    At present, the entry of non-native personnel and vehicles into Ruili is not restricted. All medium-risk areas, community containment sites and centralized isolation sites will continue to strictly implement the current containment management measures. All jewelry and jade trading places, network broadcast rooms, cinemas, Internet cafes, KTV, chess and card rooms, gyms, training institutions, sports venues, places of religious activities and other places of gathering personnel are temporarily closed; All kinds of schools and education and training institutions are temporarily closed; Catering enterprises implement online ordering and offline delivery, allowing packaging to take away, temporarily not open to in-room food. Government affairs centers, financial insurance, water, electricity and communication outlets and other service Windows, public transport, farmers' markets, hotels, logistics, express delivery, beauty salons and other services can resume business under the strict implementation of the prevention and control measures,  taking necessary measures to control the flow of people.    Continue to adhere to ventilation and disinfection, flow restriction, temperature measurement, code scanning, wearing masks and other measures, strictly implement the regular nucleic acid screening of key personnel, and effectively strengthen community management. Closed management will continue to be implemented in Dubian villages.    See the website of People's Government of Yunnan Province:  https://archive.vn/D2BnD

All jewelry and jade trading places, network broadcast rooms, cinemas, Internet cafes, KTV, chess and card rooms, gyms, training institutions, sports venues, places of religious activities and other places of gathering personnel are temporarily closed; All kinds of schools and education and training institutions are temporarily closed; Catering enterprises implement online ordering and offline delivery, allowing packaging to take away, temporarily not open to in-room food. Government affairs centers, financial insurance, water, electricity and communication outlets and other service Windows, public transport, farmers' markets, hotels, logistics, express delivery, beauty salons and other services can resume business under the strict implementation of the prevention and control measures,  taking necessary measures to control the flow of people.    Continue to adhere to ventilation and disinfection, flow restriction, temperature measurement, code scanning, wearing masks and other measures, strictly implement the regular nucleic acid screening of key personnel, and effectively strengthen community management. Closed management will continue to be implemented in Dubian villages.    See the website of People's Government of Yunnan Province:  https://archive.vn/D2BnD

The epidemic prevention and control headquarters of Ruili City issued a notice of risk level adjustment on May 4, so far, the middle and high risk areas in Ruili City were cleared to zero.  At present, the entry of non-native personnel and vehicles into Ruili is not restricted. The notice allows relevant personnel to pass through from 8:00 to 22:00 every day, and is not allowed to pass through other time periods. Detaining Chinese nationals and permanent residents can leave the area by taking their temperature and scanning the code with the negative proof of effective nucleic acid test within 7 days. Government affairs centers, financial insurance, water, electricity and communication outlets and other service Windows, public transportation, farmers' markets, hotels, logistics, express delivery, beauty salons and other services will resume business under the strict implementation of prevention and control measures, and necessary measures will be taken to control the flow of people.  The epidemic prevention and control headquarters of Ruili City asked to continue to adhere to ventilation and disinfection, flow restriction, temperature measurement, code scanning, wearing masks and other measures to effectively strengthen community management, and continue to implement the closed management of the villages in Dubian.    See the website of People's Government of Yunnan Province:  https://archive.vn/c0lW2

Government affairs centers, financial insurance, water, electricity and communication outlets and other service Windows, public transportation, farmers' markets, hotels, logistics, express delivery, beauty salons and other services will resume business under the strict implementation of prevention and control measures, and necessary measures will be taken to control the flow of people.  The epidemic prevention and control headquarters of Ruili City asked to continue to adhere to ventilation and disinfection, flow restriction, temperature measurement, code scanning, wearing masks and other measures to effectively strengthen community management, and continue to implement the closed management of the villages in Dubian.    See the website of People's Government of Yunnan Province:  https://archive.vn/c0lW2

Novel coronavirus pneumonia cases were confirmed in Liaoning province from 0 to 24 in May 16th, all of which were asymptomatic infections, and 2 cases were newly diagnosed in Anhui Province, and no new cases were cured or discharged.  Announcement issued in Hubei  Novel coronavirus pneumonia in Enshi is reported in the latest bulletin of COVID-19 prevention and control headquarters in May 16th. The latest bulletin of the COVID-19 prevention and control command in May 16th showed that 38 people (18 people in Badong County, 10 in Lichuan, 6 in Enshi, 1 in Xuanen County, 2 in Xianfeng County, 1 in Jianshi county) had been implemented.  Circular of Huangzhou District of Huanggang City on the detection of a close contact in Feixi district on May 13, 2021, a close contact of a confirmed case in Feixi entered Huangzhou district. At 16:00 on May 14, Huangzhou CDC conducted a centralized isolation medical observation; From the 14th to the 16th, three nucleic acid tests and one antibody test were carried out successively, and the results were all negative. Ten close contacts in Huangzhou District have been identified, and centralized isolation medical observation measures have been implemented. The nucleic acid test results of 10 people are all negative, and the antibody test results are normal. The close contacts outside the area have sent letters to the territory for investigation and control. In addition, 93 environmental samples were collected from newbinkai Hotel and idyllic Chinese fast food chain, and the nucleic acid test results were negative. Circular of Huangzhou District of Huanggang City on the detection of a close contact in Feixi district on May 13, 2021, a close contact of a confirmed case in Feixi entered Huangzhou district. There is no change in the policy. From May 21, 2021, a new round of COVID-19 has occurred in Guangdong, and the mutant COVID-19 virus from India has been discovered. However, this has not affected most policies in Shandong Province.

Because of the outbreaks in Guangdong provinces, the Chongqing CDC has warned the public not to travel to medium-high risk areas unless there are special circumstances.  Archived:https://archive.vn/3Kj3q

On 22 May, the Chongqing CDC reminds the public that since May 8, 2021, people from the middle (high) risk areas of Guangzhou have actively cooperated with the implementation of nucleic acid testing, epidemiological investigation, health monitoring, quarantine control and other epidemic prevention and control measures. At the same time,  starting from May 22, 2021, people coming to Chongqing from or passing through the middle (high) risk area of Guangzhou shall hold a negative nucleic acid test certificate within 7 days before entering Chongqing, and shall report to the community (village committee) after arriving at the destination, and accept the management of the community (village committee).  Archived:https://archive.vn/3Kj3q

In response to the sudden outbreak of the new crown pneumonia epidemic in Guangdong, Heilongjiang Provincial Center for Disease Control and Prevention issued reminders on the relevant requirements. Residents should always pay attention to personal health protection, maintain safe social distance, and develop good hygiene habits such as wearing masks (especially when taking public transportation and activities in confined public places), washing hands frequently, ventilating frequently, and reducing unnecessary gatherings for dinner.  https://archive.vn/yPKU2  https://archive.vn/ZvKk5
There is no policy change, but reducing trips to epidemic-risk areas is recommended according to the reminders issued on May 22.   https://archive.vn/yPKU2  https://archive.vn/ZvKk5

While there is no policy change (please refer to the 28/03/2021 note), in response to the sudden outbreak of the new crown pneumonia epidemic in Guangdong, Heilongjiang Provincial Center for Disease Control and Prevention issued reminders on the relevant requirements, especially mentioning that vaccination is an effective measure to prevent new coronary pneumonia, which can reduce the infection rate, hospitalization rate, severe illness rate and mortality rate, so that eligible residents over 18 years old are requested to make an appointment for registration as soon as possible.   https://archive.vn/yPKU2  https://archive.vn/ZvKk5

Departments for the inspection of the entry passages and local personnel who have lived in Liwan District, Guangzhou City, Guangdong Province must check the negative nucleic acid test information within 3 days before entering Ningxia, and implement 7-day home health monitoring and two Secondary nucleic acid detection measures. measures.Before the test report is fed back, it is necessary to strengthen the management and control of relevant personnel to prevent loss of management. https://archive.vn/Gb5KS

After Yingkou (Liaoning), Shenyang (Liaoning), Hefei (Anhui), and Liuan (Anhui), Guangzhou (Guangdong) became the fourth city which recently recorded a local case. The case was confirmed in 21 May: the local government marked the area in where the patient lives as [mid-risk] the following day. By 23 May, there are 23 [mid-risk] areas: one in Guangzhou, one in Hefei, six in Liuan, 11 in Yingkou, and four in Shenyang. Other areas are [low-risk], where life has to a large extent back to normal.    https://archive.vn/6qMHC

On May 28, Hubei Government made a reply for the saying that 'The first dose of COVID-19 vaccines will be suspended since June 10'. During the period of June 10 and June 30, the second dose of vaccination will be carried out mainly for those who have completed the first dose of vaccination in the previous period, and for those who have not received the first dose due to special reasons. From 29 May, entertainment venues, indoor cultural and sports venues, wholesale markets (except farmers' markets) and childcare institutions for students will be closed, kindergartens and training institutions will suspend offline teaching, and catering establishments will be banned from dine-in food.
From 29 May 2021, all people in some areas of Guangzhou will be reduced to going out and not attending gatherings    link: https://archive.vn/neNKE#selection-539.18-539.81
From 29 May, all people in some areas of Guangzhou will be reduced to going out and not attending gatherings  link:https://archive.vn/neNKE#selection-539.18-539.81

From May 29th, all entrances and exits of some stations on Line 1 of the Guangzhou Metro will be restricted to exits only, and the Nanpu Station on Line 2 will be closed to the public.    link:https://archive.vn/aX3Ku

From May 29, all people in some areas of Guangzhou will mainly stay at home and stop all activities that are not essential to their daily lives, except for one person per household per day, who will not be allowed to go out to buy daily necessities.    link:https://archive.vn/neNKE#selection-531.0-531.52

From May 29, Guangzhou will implement graded prevention and control; from May 30, car drivers and passengers leaving Guangzhou province will be required to provide proof of nucleic acid testing within 72 hours   link:https://archive.vn/CwsUv

Due to the condition that some confirmed cases appeared in Guangzhou and Shenzhen, Hubei Provincial Education Department again emphasized the necessity of maintaining normalised preventions and controls for COVID-19, paying high attention to preventions and emergency plans, ensuring the duties and responsibilities of different sections in schools. In response to the sudden outbreak of the new crown pneumonia epidemic in Guangdong, Heilongjiang Provincial Center for Disease Control and Prevention issued reminders on the relevant requirements. Residents should always pay attention to personal health protection, maintain safe social distance, and develop good hygiene habits such as wearing masks (especially when taking public transportation and activities in confined public places), washing hands frequently, ventilating frequently, and reducing unnecessary gatherings for dinner.   https://archive.vn/ZVXK1

While there is no policy change (please refer to the 28/03/2021 note), in response to the sudden outbreak of the new crown pneumonia epidemic in Guangdong, Heilongjiang Provincial Center for Disease Control and Prevention issued reminders on the relevant requirements, especially mentioning that vaccination is an effective measure to prevent new coronary pneumonia, which can reduce the infection rate, hospitalization rate, severe illness rate and mortality rate, so that eligible residents over 18 years old are requested to make an appointment for registration as soon as possible.   https://archive.vn/ZVXK1

On May the 29th, the Sichuan Health Commission issued a notification to clarify a few rumors:  1. Rumors said the first dose of vaccination would not be given after June the 6th, and that is fake. The Health Commission says the second dose vaccination would mainly be carried out during June the 10th-30th, but in July the vaccination of the first doses would be given again, so there's no need to panic.  2. Rumors said that after June the 9th the vaccination would not be free anymore, and that is fake. The Government-funded vaccination policy would  continue.  3. Sichuan has sufficient supply for vaccines and can meet the need of the residents in recent and further periods.      http://web.archive.org/web/20210530045242/http://wsjkw.sc.gov.cn/scwsjkw/gzdt/2021/5/29/62f5de9da545492d8580b3c05eab0bf7.shtml

'Health authorities have imposed travel restrictions in Guangdong and mass testing is under way as they scramble to contain a Covid-19 outbreak in the southern Chinese province, where a fast-spreading strain first found in India has been detected.  Twenty new locally transmitted cases were confirmed on Sunday [30 May 2021] – 18 in Guangzhou and two in neighbouring Foshan, the Guangdong Health Commission said. That brings the total to 47 cases, 21 of them asymptomatic, since the outbreak began on May 21.  A lockdown is in place in the worst-hit area, a district of Guangzhou, and from 10pm on Monday [31 May 2021] anyone who wants to leave the province must show a negative test result from within 72 hours before departure. Nearly 500 flights had been cancelled at airports in Guangzhou and Shenzhen – the third city to report cases in the latest outbreak – as of Monday morning.  ...  No one can enter or leave the affected areas, as interior designer Yang Rui found out when she tried to go to work on Saturday morning.'    https://archive.vn/rNyux

National Office for the Elderly People announced a notice on the prevention and control of Covid-19 for the elderly people in the winter and spring season. The notice has two parts: 1) it encourages the elderly to avoid unnecessary travels, wear masks, wash their hands often, and avoid gatherings to reduce their risk of exposure to the disease, and 2) it urges elderly care facilities to continue to follow previous guidelines issued by the government. (https://archive.vn/DEUIZ)  https://archive.vn/hPkOz

According to the "Notice on Covid Prevention and Control'' on Health Guizhou Wechat official account, in response to the recent covid emergency in Guangzhou province, the following policies are adopted:    1.	Guizhou residents who have travelled to Guangzhou City or Fuoshan City and whose travel route overlaps with covid cases must report their situation to their community and follow the covid prevention and control laws of their community.   2.	People entering Guizhou from Guangzhou prior to May 31st must have a negative covid test result within 7 days of entering the province. If they don’t, they must receive a test upon arrival, after which they can move within the province, avoiding crowded places and events. While People entering Guizhou from Guangzhou prior to May 31st must have a negative covid test result within 72 hours of entering the province.   3.	People living in Guizhou who have been to Guangzhou since May 18th must go to the nearest testing site and get tested.   4.	People living in Guizhou who have been to Guangzhou since May 7th or Foshan since May 14th, if they have fever or cough, must go to the nearest testing site and get tested.   5.	All people in Guizhou must avoid going to medium- and high- risk regions, especially Guangzhou and Fuoshan.   archive: https://archive.fo/amMqz

The Epidemic prevention and Control Office of Shanxi Province issued a reminder on June 3:1. It is recommended that people do not go to mediun or high-risk areas in the country unless nessery. If someone must go , they should be master destination policies in advance and be sure to take personal protection through put the process. 2. From now on, the personnel from Guangdong should provide the nucleic acid test negative report within 72 hours. If not, please cooperate with the local epidemic prevention and control department for nucleic acid detection. 3. Those who come to (return to) Shanxi with a history of living in high-risk areas and epidemic areas within 14 days should take the initiative to report to their communities (villages) and units at the first time, and actively cooperate with the local authorities to implement nucleic acid detection, health monitoring, isolation control and other epidemic prevention measures. For those who have a history of living in high-risk areas within 14 days, they should actively cooperate with the local authorities to carry out 14 days of home or centralized isolation medical observation; The residents from other low-risk areas in Guangdong should cooperate with the implementation of 7-day home health monitoring.    http://wjw.shanxi.gov.cn/wjywl02/29009.hrh    Archive available upon request.

On 3 June, the Epidemic prevention and Control Office of Shanxi Province remind the public to continue to wear masks, frequent ventilation, frequent hand washing, keep a safe distance and other healthy living habits.    http://wjw.shanxi.gov.cn/wjywl02/29009.hrh    Archive available upon request.

Continue to adhere to preventive and control measures in public transport such as trains, planes, buses and subways and their transportation hubs, as well as in key units such as medical institutions, schools, "one old, one small" services and places where people gather such as supermarkets, cinemas and parks and scenic spots, and standardise the implementation of requirements such as temperature measurement, bright codes and wearing of masks.      https://web.archive.org/web/20210803120955/https://m.thepaper.cn/baijiahao_13003498

The province has already started deploying the prevention and control of epidemics in this year's college entrance examinations, and based on the experience of the health prevention and control of the 2020 college entrance examinations, it has strengthened the supervision of the prevention and control of epidemics in the group examinations. The focus is on mapping and monitoring the health of candidates and examination personnel from areas at high risk of epidemic; at the same time, it fully reflects humanistic care and provides good examination services for candidates whose "health code" is red or yellow.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210815030617/https://www.sohu.com/a/470518643_121106832

Continue to adhere to preventive and control measures in public transport such as trains, planes, buses and subways and their transportation hubs, as well as in key units such as medical institutions, schools, "one old, one small" services and places where people gather such as supermarkets, cinemas and parks and scenic spots, and standardise the implementation of requirements such as temperature measurement, bright codes and wearing of masks.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210607143347/https://kxlogo.knet.cn/seallogo.dll?sn=a14062711010650606ss9p000000&size=0

On April 27, 2021, Zhejiang government issued measures for staying at home requirements are maintained as before, such as take home health isolation observation for key personnel.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210510121938/https://m.thepaper.cn/baijiahao_12425436

According to the development of the epidemic in Guangzhou City, Shenzhen City and Foshan City of Guangdong Province, the health management requirements for people coming to and returning from the above-mentioned areas are dynamically adjusted in accordance with the province's regular and precise intelligent control mechanism. The two high-risk areas of Baihedong Street and Zhongnan Street in Liwan District, Guangzhou, and the seven medium-risk areas of Jinlong Huixinge, Dongjiao Street and Chongkou Street in Longjin Street, Liwan District, Guangzhou, Jinxiu East District in Jinxiu Peninsula Community in Luopu Street, Panyu District, Tangge in Nanzhou Garden in Ruibao Street, Haizhu District, Guicheng Street in Nanhai District, Foshan City, and Luyin Ming Yuan District in Shiwan Town Street, Chancheng District, require that people should suspend coming to Zhejiang and returning to Zhejiang. If they have come to Zhejiang and returned to Zhejiang, they should strictly implement the "14+7" health management measures, i.e. 14 days of centralized isolation medical observation + 7 days of daily health monitoring.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210607143347/https://kxlogo.knet.cn/seallogo.dll?sn=a14062711010650606ss9p000000&size=0

As of June 3, the province had received a total of 22.722 million doses of the first dose of vaccine, with a cumulative total of 33.152 million doses. Based on a resident population of 58.5 million, the province's first dose vaccination rate was 38.8%, with 9.292 million people having completed the full course of vaccination and a full course of vaccination rate of 15.9% for the entire population.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210607143347/https://kxlogo.knet.cn/seallogo.dll?sn=a14062711010650606ss9p000000&size=0

On June 9, 2021, according to the Health Commission of Gansu Province, the first dose of Novel Coronavirus vaccine had been vaccinated in 10.59 million people in Gansu Province as of June 8. From June 9 to the end of June, Gansu will receive the second dose of vaccine mainly for those who have completed the first dose earlier. At the same time, those with special needs (such as going abroad) continue to receive the first dose of vaccine. The first and second doses of normal scheduled inoculation will resume from July 1. On 11 June, the Health Commission of Shanxi Province issued a reminder for the prevention and control of the epidemic during the Dragon Boat Festival, requiring all key personnel with a history of living in high-risk areas within 14 days, entering Shanxi and returning to Shanxi after the expiration of the entry isolation period outside the province, should actively report to the community (village) and unit where they are located, accept community management, and actively cooperate with the local implementation of nucleic acid Epidemic prevention measures such as testing, health monitoring, and isolation control are required. After the expiration of the entry quarantine period from outside the province, people entering Shanxi and returning to Shanxi must strictly implement 7-day home health monitoring and two nucleic acid tests. During this period, they should monitor their body temperature and symptoms, strictly personal protection, reduce contact with others, and refrain from participating in gathering activities.    http://wjw.shanxi.gov.cn/wjywl02/29131.hrh    Archive available upon request.

National Office for the Elderly People announced a notice on the prevention and control of Covid-19 for the elderly people in the winter and spring season. The notice has two parts: 1) it encourages the elderly to avoid unnecessary travels, wear masks, wash their hands often, and avoid gatherings to reduce their risk of exposure to the disease, and 2) it urges elderly care facilities to continue to follow previous guidelines issued by the government. (https://archive.vn/DEUIZ)  https://archive.vn/hPkOz

On 26 February, the Ministry of Education of the People's Republic of China released the technical plan to prevent and control the Covid-19 epidemic for colleges and universities, primary and secondary schools, and kindergartens (the third edition). The plan is the guideline for school opening in spring 2021. It requires all kinds of schools to do a good job in sanitation, disinfection, health monitoring, and maintaining social distance. This policy is still valid as of 30 April 2021.  https://archive.vn/RULX5

The National Health Commission issued the "notice on guiding the public to wear masks scientifically", in situations where staying at home, in outdoor open space, no gathering and the ventilation is good, people do not need to wear masks. For mid and low-risk areas, masks are required when the social distance is less than 1 meter.  https://archive.vn/mRT0n  Chinese expert on infectious disease, Doctor Zhang Wenhong, claimed that it is unlikely for the general public to stop wearing masks until the end of next year.  https://archive.vn/ex8DQ

'As of Saturday [19 June], 1,010,489,000 doses had been given to people in China, according to the country’s National Health Commission (NHC). More than 100 million doses had been administered in the six days up to and including Saturday. It’s unclear how many people have been full inoculated as the government does not release those numbers. But Zhong Nanshan, one of China’s top health experts attached to the NHC, said in March that the country is aiming to have 40% of the population fully vaccinated by the end of June.'  https://archive.vn/p83a4    The NHC expects to  have at least 70% of the population vaccinate by the end of the year.  https://archive.vn/mGzBx

The Chongqing Center for Disease Control and Prevention has warned residents not to travel to the cities of Guangzhou, Shenzhen, Foshan and Dongguan in Guangdong province unless necessary. If you really need to go, please be sure to take good care of personal protection. After returning to Chongqing, you should take the initiative to report to your unit and the local community (village committee) and accept the management measures of the community (village committee).  Archived:https://archive.vn/3FixP

People from cities such as Shenzhen, Guangzhou, Foshan, Dongguan and Zhanjiang should be checked for a 48-hour negative proof of nucleic acid, otherwise they will be tested for nucleic acid, and they can only flow freely when the result is negative. Those from medium-high risk areas will be quarantined for 14 days.  Archived:https://archive.vn/nClyD  https://archive.vn/8QP8c

The policy of prohibiting the entry of personnel from some countries mentioned in the November 4th, 2020 policy and the policy of relaxing application for Chinese visas for foreigners vaccinated with Chinese-made COVID-19 vaccine mentioned in the March 15th, 2021 policy are still applicable.    https://archive.vn/rTb5J#selection-2049.9-2049.96  https://web.archive.org/web/20210306082823/https://baijiahao.baidu.com/s?id=1682962825541273179&wfr=spider&for=pc  https://archive.vn/BRl7y#selection-1599.1-1599.30

The National Health Commission issued the "notice on guiding the public to wear masks scientifically", in situations where staying at home, in outdoor open space, no gathering and the ventilation is good, people do not need to wear masks. For mid and low-risk areas, masks are required when the social distance is less than 1 meter.  https://archive.vn/mRT0n  Chinese expert on infectious disease, Doctor Zhang Wenhong, claimed that it is unlikely for the general public to stop wearing masks until the end of next year.  https://archive.vn/ex8DQ

National Office for the Elderly People announced a notice on the prevention and control of Covid-19 for the elderly people in the winter and spring season. The notice has two parts: 1) it encourages the elderly to avoid unnecessary travels, wear masks, wash their hands often, and avoid gatherings to reduce their risk of exposure to the disease, and 2) it urges elderly care facilities to continue to follow previous guidelines issued by the government. (https://archive.vn/DEUIZ)  https://archive.vn/hPkOz

The policy of prohibiting the entry of personnel from some countries mentioned in the November 4th, 2020 policy and the policy of relaxing application for Chinese visas for foreigners vaccinated with Chinese-made COVID-19 vaccine mentioned in the March 15th, 2021 policy are still applicable.    https://archive.vn/rTb5J#selection-2049.9-2049.96  https://web.archive.org/web/20210306082823/https://baijiahao.baidu.com/s?id=1682962825541273179&wfr=spider&for=pc  https://archive.vn/BRl7y#selection-1599.1-1599.30

According to the development of the epidemic in Guangzhou City, Shenzhen City and Foshan City of Guangdong Province, the health management requirements for people coming to and returning from the above-mentioned areas are dynamically adjusted in accordance with the province's regular and precise intelligent control mechanism. The two high-risk areas of Baihedong Street and Zhongnan Street in Liwan District, Guangzhou, and the seven medium-risk areas of Jinlong Huixinge, Dongjiao Street and Chongkou Street in Longjin Street, Liwan District, Guangzhou, Jinxiu East District in Jinxiu Peninsula Community in Luopu Street, Panyu District, Tangge in Nanzhou Garden in Ruibao Street, Haizhu District, Guicheng Street in Nanhai District, Foshan City, and Luyin Ming Yuan District in Shiwan Town Street, Chancheng District, require that people should suspend coming to Zhejiang and returning to Zhejiang. If they have come to Zhejiang and returned to Zhejiang, they should strictly implement the "14+7" health management measures, i.e. 14 days of centralized isolation medical observation + 7 days of daily health monitoring.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210607143347/https://kxlogo.knet.cn/seallogo.dll?sn=a14062711010650606ss9p000000&size=0

As Guangdong Province has all reverted to a low-risk area, travel restrictions for residents of parts of Guangdong Province in Zhejiang Province have returned to normal.    However, the city of Huzhou in Zhejiang Province has made regulations for people from parts of Yunnan Province, requiring that people from Dehong Prefecture in Yunnan Province should hold off travelling to Huzhou City, while making distinctions as to whether they are negative for nucleic acid testing, such as.    The "3+14" health management measure is applied to people from Dehong Prefecture, Yunnan Province, other than Ruili City, who return to Huzhou, i.e. a certificate of negative nucleic acid test for the new coronavirus within 3 days must be verified upon arrival at the destination, and for those who do not have the certificate, they will be tested at the nucleic acid test at the nearest designated place such as an integrated service point. Those who have tested negative for nucleic acid will be included in the 14-day routine health monitoring and will be tested again at the end of the period.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210720145848/https://m.thepaper.cn/baijiahao_13482117

On July 5th, in response to new cases rise in Yunnan Province, the Jiangxi Government issued a comprehensive policy requirement to people traveling from Ruili, Yunnan:  1)Travelers entering from Jun5th to Jun18th should do at least one COVID testing and make sure they report their traveling history to the local village or organization.  2)Travelers (or close contacts to them) entering from Jun19th to July4th should make sure they fulfilled the 14-day quarantine requirement  and make sure they report their traveling history to the local village or organization..  3) From July 5th, those who enter should provide a within-78-hours COVID negative testing result, and quarantine for 14 days followed by 7 days of stay-at-home health inspection. A testing after the 14+7 procedure should be conducted.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210706130829/https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/OJls7luOo_1eBa9ZBI8fFw

On July 14, 2021, Tongren City’s Office of the Leading Group for Responding to the Pneumonia Epidemic Caused by the New Crown Virus issued a notice stating that starting from August 1, 2021, airports, high-speed rail stations, railway stations, and passenger stations will fully carry out the "Three   Code joint check" (that is, check the health code, itinerary code, and the Phnom Penh identification code after the new crown virus vaccination at the same time); the “two-code joint check” is fully implemented in crowded places (that is, check the health code and the Phnom Penh identification code after the new crown virus vaccination at the same time.   ); For those with contraindications to vaccination, please go to the nearest vaccination point to apply for the "Certificate of Contraindications for New Coronavirus Vaccination" with your ID card and relevant disease certificate before July 31. On July 17, 2021, Jilin Province fully launched the new crown vaccination for foreigners in Kyrgyzstan. On the premise of voluntary application, informed consent, and own risk, foreigners of appropriate age in Kyrgyzstan will be included in the city's new crown vaccination population.  At present, the age requirement for foreigners in Kyrgyzstan to receive the new crown vaccine is 18 years old and above. Foreigners who have participated in the social security and medical insurance of Jilin Province and the municipality can receive free vaccination after presenting the city’s medical insurance enrollment certificate on the spot.  Foreigners who have not participated in the social security and medical insurance of Jilin Province and the municipality need to be vaccinated at their own expense if they wish to vaccinate. The current cost is 100 yuan/injection.  See the link: https://archive.vn/2Od4W#selection-97.0-97.92

Beijing uses the inactivated COVID-19 vaccine developed by Sinopharm and Sinovac.     https://archive.ph/lwCo4  https://archive.vn/XeF4L

On July 20th, in response to new cases rise in Jiangsu Province, the Jiangxi Government issued a comprehensive policy requirement to people traveling from Nanjing, Jiangsu:  1)Travelers entering from July 6th to July 20th from the two high-risk areas should make sure they fulfilled the 14-day quarantine requirement, do at least one COVID testing after they finish the quarantine, and make sure they report their traveling history to the local village or organization; travelers entering from other places in Nanjing should conduct at least one testing.  2) Travelers entering from From July 21st should provide a within-48-hours COVID negative testing result. Those who cannot provide proof should conduct testing immediately once they arrived and will not be allowed further traveling in the province until their testing shows negative.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210802083901/https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/Q6gImf6le14vAQWbPtjIiw

On July 28th, in response to new cases rise in multiple places, the Jiangxi Government issued a comprehensive policy requirement to people traveling from certain provinces:  1)Travelers entering from Zhangjiajie from July 17th to 27th should be put in 14-days quarantine. They should have no less than 2 testings before the quarantine and conduct testing every other day during the quarantine.  2) Travelers entering from Sichuan and Hunan between July 25th and 27th should make sure they fulfilled the 14-day stay-at-home observation and avoid attending mass gatherings and taking public transportation, do no less than 2 COVID testing .  3) Travelers entering from July 28th should provide a within-48-hours COVID negative testing result. Those who cannot provide proof should conduct testing immediately once they arrived and will not be allowed further traveling in the province until their testing shows negative.  4) Internal movement from and to mid-level and high-level incidence areas are restricted.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210802105958/https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/wDuLPqvTxRQz41LH_iSR9A
